options: LKE_mazTest3a:测试 Bornanew 那端的通讯状况

script:
BeginMission lke
AddTextSmall "获得了 Jethro Bornanew 的位置" highlight
$global.lke_contactBornanew = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll DEVlkeMazTestMenuOptions

notes: # To check for the Nile Virens freebie contact

script:
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation
$option = lke_mazFreebie0 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected

text: 你切断了通讯链接。
你在礼貌地寒暄了几句之后中断了通讯链接。

options: lke_mazalotAskPMdardan:"你的管理员，Dardan Kato，好像对 '小卢德' 们的评价很低。"

text:
你发现 $personName 在听到 '小卢德' 一词时皱起了眉头。$HeOrShe停顿了一会，也许是在构思外交辞令。

"这是不可否认的，我祈祷他不要如此随意地表达自己的蔑视。这是...不体面的。如果 Mazalot 统一政权被视为对其目的很认真的话..."

"嗯，" $heOrShe有些不安， "但现在不是谈论政治的时候。所以，你在 Mazalot 的商业物流方面有什么问题吗？"
"啊，" $heOrShe在数据平板上读到了什么。"$playerName 舰长？愿你在 Mazalot 度过一段平静的时光。"
options: lke_mazalotAskPMBornanew:"我在找一个可能是左径分子的男人。"

text: "还有什么我能帮到你的吗？"
options: lke_mazalotAskPMBornanew:"我在找一个疑似参与 卢德左径 活动的人。"

text:
$HeOrShe狠狠地看了你一眼。

"卢德左径，你说 '疑似参与' ？看吧，我就知道你接下来要说什么，并且我不觉得那是个好主意。"

$personLastName 叹了口气。"安保部队已经在忙于追捕最极端的武装分子，你想说什么就说什么，但他们对此有一种... 专业感。他们知道要尊重我们之中大多数有信仰的人。通常如此。"

options: lke_mazalotAskPMresp1Opt:"这很重要，他的名字是 Jethro Bornanew 。"
lke_mazalotPMquietly:"我和你一样希望尊重信仰... 并在你的帮助下悄悄地处理这件事。"
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribay:"我有 Yaribay 家族的证件。Horus Yaribay 亲自要求我调查此事。" (说谎)
lke_mazalotAskPMchurch:"我正在为教会的大祭司调查此事。"
lke_mazalotAskPMresp5Opt:"我明白了，来说点别的吧。"

text:
"Yaribay 家族？" $HeOrShe坐直了身子， "我，呃，是的当然。"

过了一会，$heOrShe似乎对你有更高的期待。$heOrShe平静地补充道，"据我所知，Kato 家族才是，呃，最关心 Mazalot 情况的？"
options:
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayA1:"Kato，Yaribay，有什么区别么？"
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayB1:"Yaribay 想找到 Jethro Bornanew。他可能与左径分子的活动有关。"

text:
"嗯，呃，" $heOrShe似乎在思考你的问题是比喻还是字面意思，然后给出了一个谨慎的答案。

"这在很大程度上取决于你在问谁，呃，$playerSirOrMadam。如果我问这里的主官，Dardan Kato，我不会... 强调自己与 Yaribay 家族的联系。"
options:
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayB1:"我在找 Jethro Bornanew。他可能参与了左径分子的活动。"
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayB3:"有什么问题吗？"

text: "我完全理解，$playerSirOrMadam，"$heOrShe一脸茫然，好像自己除了愿意不折不扣地服从你的询问之外，没有其他任何想法。" 你将会第一个知道我有没有听说过 Jeffery Bornanew。"
options:
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayB2:"Jethro。Jethro Bornanew。"
lke_mazalotAskPMYaribayB3:"有什么问题吗？"

text:
"Jethro。当然，" $heOrShe平静地说。"我会把它记下来。"

你听到敲击数据平板的声音。

"今天你还需要港务局的其他服务吗，舰长？"

"我不确定，"$heOrShe平静地说。"我的办公室将尽一切努力为你们在 Mazalot 统一政权的利益范围内，以及附近的联盟贸易通道内的商业活动提供便利。"

你听到敲击数据平板的声音。

"今天你还需要港务局的其他服务吗，舰长？"
"是的，"$heOrShe看起来松了一口气。"我的办公室很乐意协助促进 Mazalot 统一政权和联盟监管的贸易路线范围内的商业繁荣。"

"对不起，" $heOrShe说，举止有些改变，"但我帮不了你。"

$HeOrShe看起来会交代更多，但$heOrShe还是在切断通讯连接之前说，"我祈祷你对 Mazalot 的访问是和平的，舰长。"

"哦，天哪，" $heOrShe看起来很沮丧。

"教会不应该... 我无权说教会应该做什么或不应该做什么，特别是如果牧宗师大人下令这样做，但是... 你没有告诉MUA有教会的人参与其中，对吧？" 

$HisOrHer眼神从通讯器上移开， 看到了一些不幸的景象。"我能想象到 Kato 主官发觉此事时会说些什么。"

options: lke_mazalotPMquietly:"我和你一样希望尊重信仰... 并在你的帮助下悄悄地处理这件事。"
lke_mazalotAskPMresp1Opt:"Jethro Bornanew 必须被找到。如果我找不到，那别人也会来接着找。"
lke_mazalotPMwontTellLie:"明白，我不会告诉主官的。" (撒谎)
lke_mazalotPMwontTell:"明白，我不会告诉主官的。"

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
$PersonName 注视着你，过了许久，$heOrShe的态度缓和了下来。"你没提起这份消息的来源，感激不尽。"

"众所周知，Mazalot 上的左径活动是通过一个名叫 Nile Virens 的人展开的。MUA 尚未掌握足以为其定罪的证据。不论如何，他们要是真有证据，那肯定又会发生一次暴动。毕竟 Virens 这个人...关心民众，宽厚仁爱 —— 勉强算是。"

"Virens 在一些较大的卢德聚居地有一连串的场院，另外还有几个位于前边境地带。他确实有公开的通讯 ID，但我说不准他会不会跟你谈。"

"感谢神，"$heOrShe松了一口气。"也谢谢你。无论是对信徒还是其他人而言，Mazalot 最不需要的事就是另一次镇压，或者暴动。" 

"没啥区别，"$heOrShe随口说，"一个总是跟着另一个。"

"但是嗯，我们说到哪儿了？我的部门很乐意协助 MUA 和相关联盟监管航线内的商贸活动。"

options: lke_mazalotAskBornanew:"我在找一个叫 Jethro Bornanew 的人。"
lke_mazalotAskPath:"我在寻找这里 卢德左径 活动的领导者。"
lke_mazQMTryYaribay:"我有 Yaribay 家族的证件。Horus Yaribay 亲自要求我调查此事。" (说谎)

text:
"Yaribay 氏族？"$HeOrShe立即坐的更直了些。"是的，$playerSirOrMadam，我能帮你做些什么？"

$HeOrShe瞥了眼周围，然后稍稍靠近通讯器，"如果管理员发现你在为 Yaribay 工作，好吧。他会让你日子不好过的。你要知道。我个人对他们没什么意见。甚至认为他们...是对的？与 霸主 的和平？这周每一天，我都会觉得这比战争更重要。"
options:
lke_mazQMTryYaribayA:"我需要与 Mazalot 上的 卢德左径 取得联系。"
lke_mazQMTryYaribayForget:"不如这样，忘了我说的关于 Yaribay 的任何事。"

text: "好吧。你看 —— 我不想惹上什么麻烦，你得记着我可什么都没说。我冒险仅仅是因为...我在做我该做的事。你会向 Yaribay 的人提这事么？"
options:
lke_mazQMTryYaribayA2:"我恐怕不能。我必须保护你的身份。"
lke_mazQMTryYaribayA1:"当然。" (撒谎)

text: $PersonName 顺从地笑了。
$PersonName 看起来很失望，但仍然说 "我理解，$playerSirOrMadam。"
"所有人都知道这儿 卢德左径 说了算。他们说，别碰那箱子？那你就别碰。小心点，要不他们就会让你知道谁才是老大。谁是老大呢？Nile Virens。"

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
"Virens是 Mazalot 上的 卢德左径 成员。他是老大。在地表他有个基地。有时候会有些物流运输往来，我给你详细地址，"$HeOrShe点了点数据面板。"当局没办法给他定罪。或者是不想定罪。太忌惮他了。"

"但你不一样，"$heOrShe看着你，眼神闪亮。"我的意思是，不是很怕，对么？希望你找到你想找的人。如果 Virens 自尊心受伤了？没人在意。"
"别提了，$playerSirOrMadam，"$personName 羞怯地说。
"呃，"$heOrShe说，在决定合作之前看起来有些困惑.，"当然，$playerSirOrMadam。我没听到什么。"

"Jethro？"$HeOrShe想了会。"不认识，抱歉。我这里是物流和申请业务，如果你对这方面有疑问..."

$HeOrShe一幅希望你别问了的样子。

"卢德...啊。" $HeOrShe不自在地环顾了四周。

"听着，我与那些人没有交集。统一政权把他们列入了恐怖分子名单。你明白 '协助和教唆' 的惩罚是什么吗？这对我来说不值得。"
options:
lke_mazalotAskPathQM2a:"听起来挺严重，我不会惹麻烦的。"
lke_mazalotAskPathQM2b:"'值得'？所以你知道 卢德左径 会给协作者什么报酬？"

text:
"你也该这样有样学样，"$heOrShe说。

"听着，给你点建议。如果有泥腿子鬼鬼祟祟的来找你，和你说有个活 —— 能赚大笔星币 —— 你就说，没门，没兴趣。很有可能这人是当局特工，或者舰队安全官。忠诚测试，就这样。我讲真的，当然有 卢德左径 在周边潜藏活动，但你怎么分辨呢？"

$HeOrShe耸耸肩，"如果 MUA 质询每个反政府的卢德信徒，他们就得拘留半个星球的人。这会是另一次暴动！没人希望这样。"

"哦，得了。"$HeOrShe惊愕的摇摇头。

"我只是聊天。说说而已。随便问问谁。有些泥腿子鬼鬼祟祟的说有个赚钱的机会。一大笔星币。我告诉他们没门，没兴趣，我不需要这样的麻烦。很有可能这人是当局特工，或者舰队安全官。忠诚测试，就这样。"

"如果 MUA 质询每个反政府的卢德信徒，他们就得拘留半个星球的人。这会是另一次暴动！没人希望这样。"
$HeOrShe把注意力从通讯器移到数据平板上。"也许我们能早点解决这个问题？"

options: lke_mazalotAskBornanew:"我在找一个叫 Jethro Bornanew 的人。"
lke_mazalotAskPath:"我在寻找这里 卢德左径 活动的领导者。"
lke_mazAdminTellChurch:"我作为银河救赎教会的一位大祭司的代表执行一项任务。"
lke_mazDKTellAboutYaribay:"我为 Horus Yaribay 工作。Yaribay 氏族的。你知道他们么？"

text:
突然，他的注意力集中在你身上，"对，显然。"

他的语气包含了最阴暗的怀疑，夹杂着戏谑的竞争色彩。

他顿了一下，看了看你，然后说，"Yaribay 氏族还没有愚蠢到只是…请求…我的合作。我还不确定你的情况。"
options:
lke_mazDKYaribayYouTell:"你来帮我一把，之后 Yaribay 欠你一个人情。成交吗？"
lke_mazDKYaribayAppeal:"为了 League 的利益，我需要你的帮助。"
lke_mazDKYaribayConcession:"我相信 Yaribay 氏族一定会为此做出某种让步。"

text:
Dardan Kato 突然大笑起来。这是一种绝望的、失控边缘的冲动。你怀疑，是兴奋剂过量。

他花了一分钟才平静下来。

"哦，谢谢你，" 他擦去眼泪，"我需要这个。多么美好的一天 —— 啊，还有，爱国主义！—— 你说 Yaribay？" 他摇摇头，"真是好礼物。我要感谢他们给我带来了如此精彩的笑话。"
"怎样都好，" Dardan Kato 说，"我不准备让那些只会提出含糊让步提议的 Yariaby 鼻涕虫在这边爬来爬去。我的麻烦够多了，不需要天真大小姐们在这指手画脚。"
"哈！" Dardan Kato 的笑声毫无笑意。"在 Kato 氏族的账上，Yaribay 欠我们的远超'一个'，我也不会仅仅为了...为了什么？Yaribay 氏族的好名声？而他们的一个爪牙放开口子。"

script:
$player.ethosLiar++
$player.abusedYaribayCred++
AdjustRepActivePerson INHOSPITABLE -4
$wontTalkLKE = true
$global.angeredDardanKato = true
$option = lke_MazHangUpCommLink 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
他脸上的表情犹如冰面具一样冻住了，一只手伸向通讯开关。

"别和我说话。"

链接切断。

"Bornanew，哼，" $personName 说，"听起来像个小卢德。我建议你去查查公共目录，但我猜他会是那些认为这是 '恶魔摩洛克之书' 的人之一，对吧？"

"这么说吧... $playerLastName 舰长是吗？我在控制卢德人方面遇到的问题已经够多了。如果你想找一个卢德人，那就去问另一个。"

$HeOrShe转过身去看另一个屏幕，干脆地结束了对话。

options:
lke_mazAdminTryYaribay:"我有来自 Yaribay 家族的证件。Horus Yaribay 亲自命令我调查此事。"(撒谎)
lke_mazalotAskBornanew3:保持沉默

text:
他的眉毛扬起，"Horus Yaribay 让你来的？来这？"

"Kato 氏族看管这 Mazalot。在各种外交干涉中试图着建立点儿什么东西。Yaribay 们应当了解这点，而你更应当知道不要乱插手。"

他哼了声，"至少，你应对此保持沉默。"

"我很忙。还请祝你离开时航行顺利。"

通讯中断了。

"Bornanew，哼，" $personName 说，"听起来像个小卢德。我建议你去查查公共目录，但我猜他会是那些认为这是 '恶魔摩洛克之书' 的人之一，对吧？"

"你瞧... $playerLastName 舰长？我看到你已经加入了联盟，所以我想帮助你。但我在控制卢德信徒上遇到的麻烦已经够多了。"
options: lke_mazalotAskBornanewPL1:"所以帮帮。谁是这里 卢德左径 的老大？"

text:
"你真的想去那里吗？"$HeOrShe 看了你一会，在你制止之前摇了摇$hisOrHer的头。

"行。好吧。有一个人，Nile Virens。他是 卢德左径 里的某个高层。并且我发誓他是星系中一半爆炸事件的幕后黑手，但我无法往他身上挂任何罪名。你知道，合法的那种。所以如果我碰他，就会激怒卢德佬，我们都知道上次发生了什么。"

你注意到，现在 $personName 看起来压力很大。$HeOrShe可能需要更多的睡眠。和更少的兴奋剂。
options: lke_mazalotAskBornanewPL2:"在哪儿能找到 Nile Virens？"

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
"他有...一个要塞，我猜我可以这么称呼。地表上的坚固掩体。好吧，他们的网络隐藏在卢德信徒社群和居住区中。我会把我掌握的资料发给你。"

"这儿还有一个通讯 ID，" $heOrShe哼了一声，"不过 '摩洛克之仆' 呼叫时他不会接听的。"

"舰长。" $HeOrShe用$hisOrHer充满血丝的眼睛凝视着你，"拜托。别做什么傻事。就像我说的，卢德佬很敏感，而且人数比我们要多。"
options:
lke_mazAdminAskBornanewDKend1:"你可以信赖我。"
lke_mazAdminAskBornanewDKend2:"...我们拭目以待。感谢您的合作。"

text:
"好，... 好。"他不确定地说。

看起来他正在考虑向你发出更可怕的警告，但他在切断通讯时什么也没说。

script:
$wontTalkLKE = true
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
Dardan Kato 的脸上露出一种难以掩饰的、可怕的悔恨表情。

但他在切断通讯时什么也没说。

"还有，"$heOrShe回头看了一眼通讯器，"别搞出任何麻烦。$personLastName完毕。"

通讯中断了。

$PersonName 难以置信地看着你，然后发出一声苦笑。

"是吗？非常好，" $heOrShe翻了翻眼睛，"我需要的是个自以为是的私警，还是个雇佣兵？"

"听着，不论如何，我告诉，不，命令你 —— 不要再惹那帮小卢德的麻烦了。我最不希望看到的就是另一个 '事故'，让他们借此引来更多麻烦。"

$HeOrShe对你投以极度怀疑的目光。"听明白了吗？"
$HeOrShe低头撇了一眼数据平板，然后又看向你。"啊，你就是那个到处打听小卢德的人，对吧？"
options:
LKE_mazAdminAskBugA:"没错，你知道关于 Jethro Bornanew 的消息吗？"
LKE_mazAdminAskBugB:"你不觉得 '小卢德' 这词很不敬吗？"
LKE_mazAdminAskBugC:"我更倾向于 '忠诚者' 或者是 '求道者'。如果你喜欢，'卢德的追随者' 也可以。"

text:
$HeOrShe重重地叹了口气，然后将$hisOrHer的 TriPad 放在$hisOrHer的桌子上。

"不行。如果你一定要四处探寻那个失踪的小卢德，就别惹任何麻烦。这是个命令，死命令。" $HeOrShe又拿起那个 TriPad，"不论我为此做了什么，都是为了 Mazalot 统一政权的荣耀。"

$HeOrShe翻了翻眼睛。"不是？这就是他们的本性。"

"不论如何，我不知道你要找的那个小卢德在哪，所以别浪费时间了。那帮人已经给我弄出足够大的乱子了，而我最不希望看见的就是另一个 '事故' 激起民众的情绪。"
$HeOrShe动了动眼睛。"太好了，我一定会努力记住你喜欢的称呼方式。"

"谈到这里 —— 我很忙。还请祝你离开时航行顺利，太空人"

通讯中断了
几分钟过去，通讯界面一直保持着待机状态。你的通讯请求没有回应。
几分钟过去，通讯界面一直保持着待机状态。你的通讯请求没有回应。

你看到 Dardan Kato 的脸变得僵硬，愤懑、恼怒、恐惧五味杂陈地凸显在脸上。

"教会" 他像不愿意让别人听到一样吐出这句话，"在这里。"
options: lke_mazAdminTellChurch1:"是的，我正在搜寻一个隶属于教会的特工，他来过这里。"

text:
"不，你不在，"他咆哮道。"你不在这里。这里不欢迎你。我们也没有说过话。"

通信突然中断了。

script: AddBarEvent LKEmazalot_barEvent "找个门路宽广的人贿赂一番，以此打探 Bornanew 的消息" "这儿有不少给人 '安排事情' 的家伙，对象包括左径分子，黑市商人，还有那些不方便与他们公开交易的佣兵。或许其中就有人能给你找到 Bornanew 的线索。"

text:
你四下打听可能与 卢德左径 有联系的人，同时留意着别说得太直截了当。

宇宙民都知道遵守行星当地的规章制度实际上只是些不得不逢场作戏的东西，所以你只会被礼貌地拒绝。相对的，你也礼貌地拒绝了回过来的那些无关紧要的邀约。

最后，你终于碰到了一个似乎能给出正确答案的家伙。你拿了一份别人 "额外送的" 饮料过去凑近乎，让事情一下子就迈上了正轨。
options: lke_askMazalotBar2:"我在找人。但有些循不着正确的行径。"

text:
你四下打听可能与 卢德左径 有联系的人，同时留意着别说得太直截了当。你慢慢地觉察到在 Chalcedon 的那个 玛门之仆 出了那些事之后，周围多了一些警惕的意味。

宇宙民都知道遵守行星当地的规章制度实际上只是些不得不逢场作戏的东西，所以你只会被礼貌地拒绝。相对的，你也礼貌地拒绝了回过来的那些无关紧要的邀约。

最后，你终于碰到了一个似乎能给出正确答案的家伙。你拿了一份别人 "额外送的" 饮料过去凑近乎，让事情一下子就迈上了正轨。
options: lke_askMazalotBar2:"我在找人。但有些循不着正确的... 行径。"

script:
SetTextHighlights "3,000"
SetTextHighlights "1,000"
AddText "你有 $player.creditsStrC 可用。"
SetTextHighlights $player.creditsStrC
DoCanAffordCheck 3000 lke_mazBarBribe3kOffer
DoCanAffordCheck 1000 lke_mazBarBribe1kOffer
text:
他点点头，故意端起你的酒，朝你微微一敬，然后喝了一口。

"你可能没有想象中那么迷茫。"他说，"我是搞信息技术的。不在于技术，更多在于销售，你知道吗？分发...有用的信息。"

他做了一个检查你给他的饮料的动作。"用来润喉不错。但我非常口渴"
options:
lke_mazBarBribe1kOffer:"只要一些消息？那就 1,000 星币吧。"
lke_mazBarBribe3kOffer:"我有些急事，3,000 星币怎么样？"
lke_mazBarReturn:"抱歉，我的朋友。水龙头里没水了。" (离开)

text: "1,000 星币，我会帮你联系到 卢德左径 。" 他确认了交易的内容，并从袖子下拿出一个数据平板，让你确认转账。
options:
lke_mazBarAgent:把星币转给他
lke_mazBarReturn:"不好意思，朋友。水龙头里没水了"  (离开)

text: "3,000 星币，我会帮你联系到 卢德左径 ，"他确认了交易的内容，并从袖子下拿出一个数据平板，让你确认转账。
options:
lke_mazBarAgent:把星币转给他
lke_mazBarReturn:"不好意思，朋友。水龙头里没水了"  (离开)

text:
你摸了摸数据平板，屏幕上闪现出 Mazalot 统一政权安全部门的徽章。一位官员向你微微一笑。

"$playerName 舰长，根据 Mazalot 统一政权的法律，你被指控犯有星际恐怖主义罪。" 

他用法言法语滔滔不绝，乐此不疲。

你在考虑自己的选择：你怀疑就算逃过这个诱捕程序，当局的报复行动充其量也只会是象征性的 —— 这感觉更像是一场欺骗天真的太空旅人的信用诈骗，而不是什么严肃的调查。

options: lke_mazBarAgentRespYaribay:"在我们继续之前，请允许我向你展示我从 Yaribay 家族那里得到的外交证书。"
ke_mazBarAgentRespLeague:"特工，你应该知道我是 英仙座联盟 舰队的一名授权私掠者。"
lke_mazBarAgentRespArchcurate:"特工，我是银河救赎教会的大祭司的代表。"

script: SetStoryOption lke_mazBarAgentRespSiyavong general "告诉 Mazalot 当局的安全部官员你是 Finlay Siyavong，并且在执行秘密任务"
options: lke_mazBarAgentRespSiyavong:"我是舰队情报部的 Finlay Siyavong，我有问题要问你。"
lke_mazBarAgentOptPunch:给 MUA 特工的脸来上一拳，然后迅速逃跑

text:
特工在讲话的过程中突然停住，直勾勾地看着你。你已经拿出了 TriPad 并展示出身份验证信息。他迅速地敲了几下数据平板，拿它和你的 TriPad 反复对比。也许他希望那些信息并不如你所说的那样一致。

"舰长。" 特工挺了挺身子，把数据平板塞回去，撤掉了脸上那虚伪的笑容。"恐怕我们之间有些误会。Yaribay 氏族备受尊敬，MUA 自然也欢迎他们在当地进行商业活动。如果地方安全部能够，呃，在商业方面提供帮助..."
options: lke_mazBarAgentHelp1:"谁运作附近的 卢德左径？ 我需要他的信息。"

text:
这个特工话说到一半戛然而止，看向了你 —— 是的，你没在开玩笑 —— 然后在数据平板上飞快地敲了几下，目光在你和平板之间来回对照。

"这位舰长，" 数据平板被收到了一边，这个特工站的笔直，脸上抹去了笑容，"之前恐怕有一些误解。MUA 组织，理所当然地，全力以赴地，支持着联盟舰队，" 他与你目光交接，亲切地点头，"—以及让我们的部队如虎添翼的签约私掠者们。"

"请允许我代表 Mazalot 地方安全部，为，呃，舰队行动，提供一切必要的协助..."
options: lke_mazBarAgentHelp1:"谁运作附近的 卢德左径？ 我需要他的信息。"

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
不久之后，你就将当地左径头目 Nile Virens 的档案转移到了你的数据平板上。联系方式、地址和不完整的生物信息。在所有的主要卢德教徒聚居地都有驻地。在 Mazalot 上有效地指挥左径活动。

"你需要提防那个人，" 特工收起数据平板并站了起来。"他确实是个狡猾的人。在哪一点上都没法定他的罪，总有一些年轻的卢德佬会替他来坦白。" 特工用一种同志般和蔼的眼神看着你，"很高兴他们终于呼叫了大炮。你要..." 他比了一个枪的手势，眨了眨眼睛。

"我猜你也不会告诉我。"
options:
lke_barEnd:一言不发地离开
lke_barEnd3:"您的帮助会记录在行动后的报告内。"

script:
SetTextHighlights "5,000"
AdjustRep persean SUSPICIOUS -2
$player.ethosTruth++
AddText "你有 $player.creditsStrC 可用。"
SetTextHighlights $player.creditsStrC
FireAll LKEMazBarAgentFineResps
text:
"哦？那我祝卢德好运啊。" 特工举起数据平板，随着一阵闪烁，他迅速地给你拍了一张全息影像，好用来登记你的 '罪行'。

"或许你可以掏出你们这些 '驴德' 修士从可怜的老奶奶们那里收来的什一税，来支付你的罚金。而这个数额是，" 他又在平板上敲了几下，"5,000 星币。"

options: lke_mazBarAgentKatoThreat:"我不确定这是否符合 Kato 管理员的政策。也许我们应该联系他？"
lke_mazBarAgentLoud:(提高声音) "我认为 MUA 会配合教会对 卢德左径 活动的调查。"
lke_mazBarAgentOptPunch:给 MUA 特工的脸来上一拳，然后迅速逃跑

text: 客服人员僵住了，弯腰盯着数据平板，虚假的 '正常' 交易请求在闪烁。他的眼睛一眨不眨地看着你，表情严峻。 判断你是否是认真的。
options:
lke_mazBarFineEyeContact:保持眼神接触
lke_mazBarFine5k:缴纳罚款

text:
你瞬间化为目光焦点。邻桌聚会的人又仔细打量了一下，决定趁现在这个好时机赶紧付账走人。

特工的目光锁定了你，脸上挂着冰冷的假笑。"我知道你在试探些什么。教会不是这个国家的主事者，联盟才是。"

他目不转睛地凝视着你，揣摩不定。
options:
lke_mazBarFineEyeContact:保持眼神接触
lke_mazBarFine5k:缴纳罚款

text: 你傲视着 Hesperus 的行星教卫。区区 Mazalot 来的地方安全部官员？不值一提。在伟大的猎户座之龙面前，他不过是一只舱底的蟑螂罢了。
你的目光像等离子体一样灼热，它撕裂了这个地方安全部的恶霸，就像引力子束在遍布血与灰的太空战场中闪耀；你看到了他不会相信的事情。难以想象的浩瀚，最可怕和残酷的真空。

他的目光落在了他愚蠢的泊位管理员数据平板上。他害羞地把平板塞进口袋，嘴里嘟囔着误会，拖着脚步走开了。

你独自站着。

他的眼神死板而权威，就像一台设定了攻击程序的机器。没有人与人之间的联系，没有同理心。在你的想像中，只有一个身处速子科技秘密空间站，被剥夺了情感模块的伽玛级AI才能有此等表情。

"罚款，" 他说，"5,000星币。"
options:
lke_mazBarAgentOptPunch:在 MUA 特工的脸上来一拳，然后逃跑
lke_mazBarFine5k:缴纳罚款

text:
你交了罚款。

"注意安全，公民。" MUA 特工露出敷衍、虚伪的微笑，"这个地方挤满了恐怖分子的同情者。"

他离开了。

官方数据平板消失了，取而代之的是另一个更破旧的数据平板。一笔星币转账等待着你的确认。

"你可以在这缴纳你的，啊，罚款。我知道你已经对违法行为表示悔恨，所以我会确保这件事不会出现在官方记录中。"

他眨了眨眼。
options:
lke_mazBarAgentRespBribe2:星币转账
lke_mazBarAgentOptPunch:在 MUA 特工的脸上来一拳，然后逃跑

text:
转账提示响了之后, 特工露出了一个一点不真诚的微笑。

"注意安全，公民" 他说。
options: lke_mazBarAgentRespBribe3:"等下。 我为这情报付了钱的 — 我可期望得到它。"

text:
一阵困惑，然后他脸上浮现出冷笑。

"别跟我耍小聪明，太空人 —— 你不会想让我心情不好的。"

options: lke_mazBarAgentRespBribe4:"我们要和 Dardan Kato 联络并解释下我刚刚的贿赂吗？"
lke_mazBarAgentRespBribe4:"我们要和主管联络并解释我刚刚的贿赂吗？"

script:
AdjustRep persean SUSPICIOUS -2
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
他的冷笑消失了。你有那么蠢吗？不会吧？他仿佛在用表情这么问。你轻轻点头。没错，你就那么蠢。你还做过蠢得更离谱的事，而且能全身而退。

不久之后，你让一份关于本地左径铁腕人物 Nile Virens 的档案转到了你的数据平板上。包括相关人士信息、地址和一份零散不堪的简介。 在所有主要的卢德聚居区都运营有定居点。 那基本上就是在暗地里领导整个 Mazalot 的左径了。

"你们俩都是自找的，" 警官在离开时抱怨道。

重重的一击使安保人员摔倒在桌子上，桌子乖乖地翻了过来，让玻璃器皿和醉鬼洒落在酒吧里。

一直监视着你的地方安全部便衣站了起来，抽出电击器。

你成功地避开了他们，这要归功于喊叫、混乱，以及你的保镖在没有暴露和你关系的前提下进行的令人钦佩的干扰。

你溜出酒吧，玻璃破碎和呐喊起哄的声音抛在身后。这时你忽然回想到那些地方安全部的蠢货们肯定都开着全息记录仪，因此这并不是一次完美的逃亡。

但这或许也不是什么值得当局大惊小怪的事。毕竟你又不是第一个干架之后跑路的太空佬，这种事无论在 Mazalot 还是在其他的什么地方都不可能没发生过。而考虑到你们这种人能带来的商业价值，一些忍让肯定还是会被做出的。

不过嘛，某个人肯定会记得的。

这条子隶属地方安全部，一个腐败的底层混混。你知道如果这样的恶霸相信你的地位更高，他们很容易屈服。而英仙座联盟舰队情报部门是联盟中的精英，里面都是氏族子弟。

"警官。" 你带着 Kazeron 的贵族口音，还有自信和优越感，"回答前好好想想。"

"我本来也不想到这个地貌改造失败的穷乡僻壤，在到处滋生的驴德佬里面追猎左径分子，但情报中透露出一股不妙的气息。你知道那意味着什么吗？— 不用回答。我收到一些令人不安的报告，与 Mazalot 统一政权安全部门的账目有关。"

这个军官立正站直，汗水涔涔而下。附近几桌人小心翼翼地装作没听到你的长篇大论。

"关于左径分子资金来源的流言，已经充斥了我的耳朵。而正如你所熟知的那样，根据联盟的星际恐怖主义法 — 就是你助人为乐给我引用的那个 — 这意味着中央监督机构将有权干预地方事务。"

"你知道这意味着什么吗？别急着回答，长官，我还没说完。"

你继续斥责着，描述了联盟中央行政部门可以对被发现参与教唆恐怖主义的成员施加的各种处罚 —— Mairaath 的数百万死者在联盟的规则制定者们心中记忆犹新，而为阻止事件重演而被赋予的权力确实意义深远。

你庆幸到，还好你之前研究过联盟的历史。

script:
Highlight "Nile Virens"
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
Before long, you have the munisec officer silent and near-tears across from you in a booth while you browse local security reports on their datapad using their own login.

You find exactly what you need - Nile Virens, local Pather strongman. Operates compounds in all the major Luddic population centers.

After transferring the information to your own TriPad you toss the officer's datapad across the table. He is too slow to catch it, and it clatters to the ground.
options:
lke_barEnd:一言不发地离开
lke_barEnd2:"您的帮助被会记录下。"

text: The agent's eyes light up at this, and their mouth opens to speak more - but you've already turned away.

id:
# LKE Nile Virens contacts you
# after somehow botching the MUA agent bar encounter

text:
Your comms officer pings you unexpectedly.

"$PlayerSirOrMadam. I received an unusual communication which- I thought it should be brought to your attention."

"$PlayerSirOrMadam. Someone who claims to work for a man named 'Virens' commed to invite you to a meeting. I did not... at first think to bring it to your attention until the details could be verified."

"Well, ah," they twitch nervously. "We verified the details."

确实，正如你的通讯官所说，Nile Virens 在 Mazalot 上扮演的一个重要角色其实是 卢德左径 当地分支的领导者 (据传)，尽管没有任何主流媒体或小道消息点明过这一不言而喻的事实。Virens 合法经营着数个慈善机构，其实都是掩护 左径组织 的前台 (据传)，且在 Mazalot 大多数重要的 卢德 聚集地中持有地产。

听懂这些弦外之意并不困难，但很危险。

除非你个雇佣了顶级保镖，并坐拥一支私人作战舰队的家伙。

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Nile Virens 的通讯 ID" highlight
AddTextSmall "获得了突袭 Nile Virens 藏身处的方案" highlight
SetPersonHidden virens false
$global.lke_contactVirens = true
$global.lke_gotVirensContactFreebie = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
$market.lkeSetUpVirensMeeting = true
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
It's almost shocking that Virens hasn't been arrested already, but his status is a political minefield for the Mazalot Unification Authority. To crack down might instigate another uprising. To not crack down allows Pather influence to simmer just under the boiling point.

And now, Nile Virens has invited you for tea.

Your officers, of course, have rapidly assembled a tactical report on Virens' holdings for your review.

You execute the command to open comms for Nile Virens. Your interface links to the MUA network, its motto blinking for a moment - something about "diversity of belief and good order" - then forwards through a series of ancient off-the-forge low-power relays displaying embedded logos of the long-dead megacorp that once claimed ownership of the hardware.

Your request hangs in the limbo, request bouncing between nodes on the Mazalot network.

Nile Virens isn't answering.
options:
lke_virensCommsFirstWait:Have your comms officer babysit the link request
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text: 你的通讯官带着些许职业水平的热忱接下了这项乏味的任务。在此期间，你将转而处理管理$shipOrFleet的一些日常事务。

几分钟后，你的通讯官给你发来了最新消息。

Nile Virens 一直没有激活通讯器；看来他 "不使用通讯器" 。但终于有一个自称是他同事的人回复了，并转达了一个邀请...
options: lke_virensComms3:"他邀请我去喝杯茶是吗？"

text:
"Um," your comms officer is caught off guard. "Yes, $playerSirOrMadam, he has. For tea."

You consider your options.
It is possible that word of your killing of Sedge has made its way to Virens, whether he uses comms or not. You imagine that he may take a dim view of your action on Chalcedon.

options: 3:lke_shuttleToVirens:Take a shuttle down to meet with Nile Virens

text:
From the shuttle you admire the atmospheric display resulting from Mazalot's strong magnetic field; spectra flare and break like ocean waves.

Your shuttle is unaffected aside from extra cleanup processing required by the comms and nav systems. 

You land on the outskirts of some Luddic-majority town in what passes for a spaceport: a field of baked gray dust. A long row of sheds might be traffic control, warehouses, or a barn for all you know.

A pair of militants wearing dust masks meet you. They're armed, but not conspicuously so.

They lead you through a town of sun-baked brick and slowly corroding salvage. Bright paint and lush gardens manage, just, to stave off a sense of apocalyptic decay.

Soon, you find yourself before a large compound with doors of etched metal. The militants are met by another pair, similarly armed. The most senior among them lowers his mask.
"$PlayerName. Blessed peace this day. Please, $playerSirOrMadam, follow me."

"$PlayerName. Blessed peace," he says, and hesitates. 

"Please. Your weapon." He indicates your sidearm.
options:
lke_virensGunCheckA:交出你的随身武器
lke_virensGunCheckB:"放心，我来这射爆谁的。"
lke_virensGunCheckC:"我不会交出我的随身武器的。"
lke_virensGunCheckD:"那得等我死透之后你才能从我手上拿走它。"
lke_virensGunCheckE:返回你的穿梭机

text:
The lead guard accepts it with both hands, giving a little bow, then tucks it into a holster on the front of his webbing. 

A place of honor? Or at least a visible demonstration that he's going to keep a close eye on your gun.

The guards glance nervously at one another. Someone mutters something at the edge of your hearing.

The leader gives a hiss and they shut up.

"Please, if you would," he says. "You are a guest of Brother Virens. He guarantees your safety on this world."

The guards glance nervously at one another, muttering. The leader gives a hiss and they shut up.

"Please, if you would," he says. "You are a guest of Brother Virens. You will not be touched on this world."

The leader almost looks sad for a moment, then something shifts in his eyes and his expression is left dull but alert.

"Then you will not meet with Brother Virens," he says. "We shall return to your shuttle."

The other guards are tense.
Virens' militants escort you back through town. You see clearly now how the population avoids your route, and how you haven't, in fact, seen any MUA personnel. Anywhere.

You return to your $shipOrFleet without having met Virens.

It seems that he will only meet you if you are totally defanged. Perhaps he does not believe that your marines could 'invite' him to meet you.

The lead guard does a quick one-two knock on the doors and they swing open. 

The air is cool, the walls hung with cloth woven in bright patterns; wooden furniture prevails. A clean, earthy scent hangs in the air. You are overcome by a sense of ancient wealth - entirely underwhelming compared to the palaces of Eventide or a Tri-Tachyon executive's chateau, but here, you can tell that every object, every surface, has been transformed by the hand and muscle of human beings alone.

You are led up stairs - wooden, creaking unsettlingly - to a room overlooking an interior courtyard garden. The silhouette of a man stirs at your presence.

script:
BeginConversation virens
Call $global.lke_ref playMusicVirens
$option = lke_virensStart0 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
"Blessed peace upon you," the man says, turning toward you. "I am Nile Virens. I invite you to sit with me."

A finely-carved table is set with a tea set, simple in form and painted with delicate natural motifs.

You are gaining a sense for the quality of tea by the scent hanging in the air after boiling water is freshly poured.

This is a fine blend.
options:
lke_virensStartSit:坐下喝茶
lke_virensStartStand:继续站着

text:
With all this dealing with Luddics, you realize that you're starting to develop a sense for the quality of tea by the scent hanging in the air after boiling water is freshly poured.

This is the good stuff.
options:
lke_virensStartSit:坐下喝茶
lke_virensStartStand:继续站着

text:
You sit, and Virens pours two cups, then motions for you to choose your pick of the two.

After you do, he holds the cup up for a moment and inhales the steam.

A frown begins in his brow but fails to materialize on his mouth.

"I respect that you shall do as you wish, $playerSirOrMadam," he says, and pours a cup for himself. "My invitation stands, and you have my hospitality regardless."

options: lke_virensLookingBornanew:"我在找一个叫 Jethro Bornanew 的人。"
lke_virensAskSidearm:"你为什么收走了我的随身武器？"
lke_virensPoliteSedge:"你比 Sedge 要有礼节多了。"
lke_virensAskSedgeAlly:"How does a man like you ally yourself with a man like Sedge?"

text: Virens acknowledges your act with a nod, and raises his cup to you before sipping some tea.

"If I didn't bring you in now, it seems you'd ask everyone in the system about Jethro Bornanew, about the Luddic Path, and ultimately, about me." 

"You are blessedly persistent," he smiles indulgently. "Dangerously persistent, if left to your devices, I suspect. Others would ask why you're asking. The MUA would ask why you're asking. Too much of this asking, asking, asking. It upsets delicate things."

As he speaks, he reaches out and almost, but not quite, touches the fine teapot. He seems to realize what he is doing and pulls back.

He gives you a funny look.

"Sedge. On Chalcedon." He raises his eyebrows, "In the back? Surely you will not begrudge my caution."

Virens' mouth draws a thin line. "He is... was... not a polite man, nor pleasant. Driven, however. Quite driven."

Virens looks thoughtfully at his tea like something is wrong with it, something ineffable.
He nods, and says "He is not a polite man, nor pleasant. Driven, however. Quite driven."
"Sedge shot the man who set up the meeting in front of you."
"I am told that Sedge became... agitated. He was quick to anger, and quick to demonstrate that anger."
"我知道 Sedge 为人粗鲁，同时也很残忍。"
Virens looks thoughtfully at his tea like something is wrong with it, something ineffable.
notes:
# Virens' mouth draws a thin line. "If you wish to talk of that, then we shall," he says, putting his teacup down. 

"You killed Sedge. My understanding, which has been thoroughly informed, is that you met him to talk."

text:
Virens meets your eyes, "Though you are my guest here, and perhaps because you are my guest, I feel that I must demand an answer from you." 

"So I ask you this, $playerName. Why did you kill him?"

options:
lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe:"He would have killed me without hestitation, given the chance."
lke_virensKillSedgeDidntLike:"I didn't like him. That's why."
lke_virensKillSedgeTea:"He drank my tea. It was my. Tea."
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTech:"His anti-technological terrorism is a threat to the future of the Persean Sector."
lke_virensKillSedgeBrute:"He was a brute who ruled through terror."
lke_virensKillSedgePather:"Because he's a Pather. It's what all Pathers deserve."
lke_virensKillSedgePurity:"His manner and actions pollute the purity of the Path."
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeLies:Consider a lie to answer with...

text: Virens is a perceptive and cultured man. The truth will serve.

options:
lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe:"He would have killed me without hestitation, given the chance." (lie)
lke_virensKillSedgeDidntLike:"I didn't like him. That's why." (lie)
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTech:"His anti-technological terrorism is a threat to the future of the Persean Sector." (lie)
lke_virensKillSedgeBrute:"He was a brute who ruled through terror." (lie)
lke_virensKillSedgePather:"Because he's a Pather. It's what all Pathers deserve." (lie)
lke_virensKillSedgePurity:"His manner and actions pollute the purity of the Path." (lie)
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeTruths:Consider telling the truth, instead...

text: You need Virens to cooperate. Perhaps a lie will help...

"I concede that he has, to my knowledge, killed many," Virens says. "And with little hesitation. By the other hand, he did speak with you; he seemed to me not a man to waste his time with talk when intent upon killing." 

"To that point," he picks up his teacup. "The deed is done. Sedge is not mine to avenge, so put any worry of that from your mind."

"You see, I am a man who does hesitate. Thoughtless action," he shakes his head. "But there are times for killing. And, after hesitation - and thought - I see that it be done."

Virens smiles unreassuringly.
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe2:"So are you thinking about killing me?"
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text:
He stares straight at you. "You did not steal my tea."

"So," he trails off, giving a one-shoulder shrug, tea steady in his other hand. "No."

Just the hint of an unexpected smile lingers.
options: lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe3:"I'm glad we cleared that up."

text: "The thought had crossed my mind," he admits. "But I think it would bring much trouble. And... I want to see what happens."
options: lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe3:"I'm glad we cleared that up."

text: "I as well," he says.
"你杀了个人就因为一杯茶？" 因为太过难以置信，Virens 那镇定自若的神色从他脸上消失了那么一小会儿。

"I understand that Sedge could be rude, yes, and even offensive. But," he shakes his head. "Death is not a thing to administer lightly."

You are certain he has made such administrations himself.
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe2tea:"So are you thinking about killing me?"
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text:
"It is easy to dislike a great many people in a great many circumstances," Virens says. "Sedge, perhaps, easier to dislike than most, I must admit."

"Still. Death is not a thing to administer lightly."

You are certain he has made such administrations himself.
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeKilledMe2:"So are you thinking about killing me?"
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text:
"I see," Virens says coldly. "It would be consistent to level the same charge against myself, yes?"

He looks at you with expectant challenge.
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechA:"I'm not sure yet."
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechB:"In due time."
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechC:"No. You seem different."

text: "Then I shall await your judgment in good spirit," he says. "Though you must understand, it is only God whose judgment for which I truly fear and hope."
"Then I shall await your wrath in good spirit," he says calmly. "Though you must understand, it is only God whose judgment for which I truly fear and hope."

"Do I?" He looks away, brow wrinkling. "Then I feel perhaps I am failing at something." 

He turns back to you, "Nonetheless, it is only God whose judgment for which I truly fear and hope."

"You are not wrong in that," Virens says. 

"And he died as he lived: through a seemingly random act of wanton violence."

You detect more than a hint of criticism in these words.
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteA:"He was a murderer. The world is better off without him."
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteB:"How can you criticize me while Pathers raid and kill?"
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteC:"That's rich coming from a Pather. Remember Mairaath?"
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text:
"Yes. But think of what you've created, back on Chalcedon."

Virens leans forward, "A hero, blessed martyr," he whispers. "Shot in the back by a spacer coward. Sedge now walks beside Ludd, and the children of Chalcedon will walk in his footsteps."

He leans back again. "You've made what was once an inconvenience an immortal, captain."

"Think of what you've created, back on Chalcedon."

Virens leans forward, "A hero, blessed martyr," he whispers. "Shot in the back by a spacer coward. Sedge now walks beside Ludd, and the children of Chalcedon will walk in his footsteps."

He leans back again. "It may be that you've made a whole new generation of raiders and killers, captain."
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteB-A:"I am not responsible for what others choose."
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteB-B:"And they will die too, if they choose murder and terrorism."
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text: "No. But they choose," Virens says.
"So they shall," Virens agrees.

He sighs. "Mairaath, yes. We're told many things of Mairaath. But think of what you've created, back on Chalcedon."

Virens leans forward, "A hero, blessed martyr," he whispers. "Shot in the back by a spacer coward. Sedge now walks beside Ludd, and the children of Chalcedon will walk in his footsteps."

He leans back again. "It may be that you've made a whole new generation of raiders and killers, captain."
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeBruteC2:"You can't simply dismiss Mairaath, and what the Path did there."
lke_virensWhyKillSedgeOut:Speak of other things

text:
"No," he says, "I cannot."

"But I will not rehash this old argument now. Remember, it is you who came to me, in my home, to ask me for a favor."
"Ah." Virens leans back, examining you coolly. "Am I next?"
options:
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechA:"I'm not sure yet."
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechB:"In due time."
lke_virensKillSedgeAntiAntiTechC:"No. You seem different."

text:
"Ah," Virens leans back, examining you coolly.

"It will take a great deal of blood indeed to wash all that is impure from the Path, and indeed from the Sector entirely."
options:
lke_virensKillSedgePurity2a:"So be it."
lke_virensKillSedgePurity2b:"Not so much once a few are made example of."

text:
"Your faith burns bright. Perhaps too bright for me, a simple man, to face unblinking." Virens adjusts his posture, uncomfortable perhaps.

"Let us speak of other things."

"Your faith burns bright. Perhaps too bright for me, a simple man, to face unblinking." Virens adjusts his posture, uncomfortable perhaps.

"Let us speak of other things."

"I concede that he has, to my knowledge, killed many," Virens says. "And with little hesitation. By the other hand, he did speak with you; he seemed to me not a man to waste his time with talk when intent upon killing." 

"To that point," he picks up his teacup. "The deed is done. Sedge is not mine to avenge, so put any worry of that from your mind."

"You see, I am a man who does hesitate. Thoughtless action," he shakes his head. "But there are times for killing. And, after hesitation - and thought - I see that it be done."

text:
"You use this word 'ally'. It is, I think, too strong a word for what was between he and I."

Virens switches his tea cup to his other hand, "Nor shall I deny the association, not once or thrice. The Path can be a twisted thing, captain, and ever am I surprised by the company with whom I walk."

"I apologize for nothing but for providing you with an unsatisfactory answer." He pours more tea, "My wife always said I was a middling host."

"Yes," Virens pauses, studying you. "I know."

"I have met this man, Bornanew, and I know where he is." He leaves the statement hanging.
options:
lke_virensLookingBornanewWhere:"Will you tell me where he is?"
lke_virensLookingBornanewWait:Let it hang; he knows what you want

text:
With a small, amused nod Virens acknowledges that you've left the gap in conversation for him, not you, to fill.

"I feel that I have some responsibility to Bornanew, you see." Virens flicks a nonexistent speck from his teacup. "Not for him in particular, but for courtesy, shall we say. My meeting with him was brief, and we have had no business or acquaintance since."

"I may," says Virens. "I feel that I have some responsibility to Bornanew." He flicks a nonexistent speck from his teacup. "Not for any particular loyalty. For the general principle. My meeting with Bornanew was brief, and we have had no business or acquaintance since."

"He did, however, tell me why he was sent here. And by who." Virens looks for your reaction.

"I would not wish to direct you to him if your intentions were... unkind."
options:
lke_virensIntentionsA:"Archcurate Jaspis wants him back. To serve her. To serve the Church."
lke_virensIntentionsB:"Whatever his mission was, it's over. The archcurate is... worried about him."
lke_virensIntentionsC:"Well, I don't get paid if I don't return with him. Or his body."

text:
Virens pulls back, frowning.

"Am I to understand that as a threat, or merely a jest made in very poor taste?"

options: lke_virensIntentionsCjoke:"My apologies. It's just spacer humor."
lke_virensIntentionsCjob:"It's a job. I'm simply being realistic."
lke_virensThreatenWithFleet:"I don't negotiate with terrorists. My fleet is in orbit."
lke_virensThreatenWithMarines:"I have a battalion of marines in orbit. Make this easy on yourself."

text: He gives you a look that contains not a hint of amusement.

text:
Virens leans back, rubbing his chin.

"Captain," he begins, "Whatever you make of my home, this settlement... Mazalot is a polity of the Persean League. Their fleets will hound you to the ends of the Persean Sector."

"I say this to make sure, very very sure, you know what you are threatening to do. So you will see why it is not necessary."
"Because I think you should speak with Bornanew yourself," he says. "I shall have my man give you the coordinates."

"I see," Virens says, looking out into the courtyard. Thinking, for a long minute. He turns back and deliberately sips some tea.

"I think you should speak with Bornanew yourself," he says. "I shall have my man give you the coordinates."

options: lke_virensEndingOptIResp1:"That wasn't so hard, was it."
lke_virensEndingOptAResp1:"Why help the Church? Are you not of a... wayward sect?"
lke_virensEndingOptBResp1:"How does this serve the Path, for me to find Bornanew for the Church?"
lke_virensEndingOptDResp1:"Why would you, a Pather, help me with this?"
lke_virensEndingOptEResp1:"You have my thanks; may a path of peace lay before you."
lke_virensEndingOptFResp1:"Just like that? Is this some kind of trap?"
lke_virensEndingOptGResp1:"One more thing- I need to find Brother Cotton."
lke_virensEndingOptHResp1:"Thank you. And for the tea."

text:
"Wayward?" He gives a soft laugh. "You can be diplomatic when you wish it."

"The Church is not all one thing. And do you think this man, this Jethro Bornanew, will help that part of the Church which seeks a dominion of orthodoxy to overcome all the Faithful, and the Sector besides?"

"Of that, I am not sure." His mouth moves toward an amused smile, but doesn't quite get there. "Burn bright, captain."

"I speak true, $playerBrotherOrSister, when I say that I do not know what Path has been set for us by Providence."

"But I do know that the Church is not all of one thing. And do you think this man, this Jethro Bornanew, will help that part of the Church which seeks a dominion of orthodoxy to overcome all the Faithful, and the Sector besides?"

"Of that I am especially unsure." His mouth moves toward a smile of amusement, but doesn't quite get there. "Burn bright, captain."

"I felt you would not wish to hear of 'the Path'. But if you wish, I will tell you briefly of the Path."

He looks down, frowning. "The Path is not all alike. In some places, the Path provides something that nothing else will. Not Kazeron, not the Hegemony, certainly not the Mazalot Unification Authority."

He looks up, changed; there is a sad fervor in his eyes that you did not see before. "We were lost. And then the Word found us. Ludd's message shines bright in the dark of space, in the shadow of the powerful. Not even the Church can contain it."

"THAT is the Path." He nearly shouts, standing. Then takes a deep breath, and a moment to smooth his fine clothing.

His lip curls in an ironic smile while his eyes narrow just slightly; some repressed anger, even rage.

"You know little of the Path, spacer. The Path provides something that nothing else will. Not Kazeron, not the Hegemony, certainly not the Mazalot Unification Authority."

He sets his teacup down firmly. There is a sad fervor in his eyes that you did not see before. "Ludd's message shines bright in the dark of space, in the shadow beneath the boot of power. Not even the Church can contain it."

He takes a deep breath, and smooths his fine clothing.

He stands to see you off.

"The Path is not all one thing, spacer, nor is the Church. Remember that."

He shakes his head at the implied accusation. "It is not."

"You know little of the Path, spacer. The Path provides something that nothing else will. Not Kazeron, not the Hegemony, certainly not the Mazalot Unification Authority."

He sets his teacup down firmly, rattling the ceramic. There is a sad fervor in his eyes you did not see before. "Ludd's message shines bright in the dark of space, and in the shadow beneath the boot of power. Not even the Church can contain it."

He stands, and takes a deep breath. Then smooths his fine clothing. "Go in peace," he says.

Virens' expression cools noticeably.

"Do you," he says; not a question. "With that, I cannot help you."
options:
lke_virensEndingOptGResp2a:"Do you have a problem with Cotton?"
lke_virensEndingOptGResp2b:"'Will not' help me, you mean."
lke_virensEndingOptHResp1:"Well, thank you anyway. And for the tea."

text:
He stands, and smooths his fine clothing, letting out a deep breath. 

"I will not speak of Cotton. Not here, not now."

He stands, and smooths his fine clothing, letting out a deep breath. 

"If you would drink a bitter tea, then I 'will not'," he emphasizes your words, "stop you."

"The Path is not all one thing, spacer, nor is the Church. Remember that." He turns back to you - and pauses halfway to catch your eye - before facing the courtyard.

"My man Fearnot will see you out."

"The Path is not all one thing, spacer, nor is the Church. Remember that." He turns back to look into the courtyard.

"My man Fearnot will see you out."
He stands to see you off, "The Path is not all one thing, spacer, nor is the Church. Remember that."

"No. Often, the cowards way is not. I pray that I am no fool in this." Virens stands, his body tense, his manner clear in seeing you gone as soon as possible.

"My man Fearnot will see you out."

text:
Virens' lead guard brings you back to the entry hall, where a secretary meets you and uses a scratched datapad to provide you with coordinates to a location on the surface of Mazalot.

Your side arm is returned, and you are accompanied back to your shuttle; the population keeps a wary distance. They know who you met, and know better than to interfere.

options: 2:lke_virensRaidStart:Prepare a raid on Virens' compounds to extract Jethro Bornanew

script:
SetEnabled lkeVirensRaidStart false
SetTooltip lkeVirensRaidStart "A nearby hostile fleet is tracking your movements, making a raid absolutely inadvisable."

$raidDifficulty = 250 0
$raidGoBackTrigger = PopulateOptions 0
$raidContinueTrigger = LKEVirensRaidFinishedB 0
$raidRestrictToTrigger = LKEVirensRaidFinishedA 0
AddRaidObjective genericIcon "Raid Viren's Pather strongholds" HIGH 3000 LKEVirensRaidFinishedA true
ShowImageVisual raid_prepare
text:
You convene your senior officers to discuss an extraction scenario for Jethro Bornanew, presumably employed or taken hostage by Nile Virens. 

It is impossible to completely avoid the MUA's defense network, although even cursory scans show that it is deployed to counter internal uprisings rather than external raids. Persean League casualties can be minimized, but certain sensor stations and defensive batteries will have to be disabled to open the way for a clean assault on Virens' bases.

The Pathers are another problem entirely: separate infiltration squads must simultaneously breach secure compounds located in densely populated settlements. Casual use of heavy weaponry among civilians would attract unwanted interference both in the immediate operation and your future activities. You must strike everywhere swiftly, unerringly, and with a light touch.

You oversee the raid from your bridge, your $shipOrFleet providing EW cover and sporadic fire support for the breaching drones and marine shuttles.

The raid hinges on mere minutes of chaos, comms throughout the hemisphere crackling with static and only tightbeam relays able to pierce the rain of EM scatter amid clouds of chaff and disruption. Casualty reports roll in, displays on your bridge bleeding to fill the space with a bloody glow.

In the confusion, more than one team reports success. This can be sorted out later. As quickly as they landed, your forces perform an orderly withdrawal, laying covering fire while hauling casualties and prisoners.

script:
AdjustRepPerson virens VENGEFUL -50
AddTextSmall "Extracted prisoners from Nile Virens compounds" highlight
$global.lke_raidedMazalotForVirens = true
Call $global.lke_ref didMazalotRaid
text:
Multiple prisoners have been taken and returned to your $shipOrFleet. None matches the admittedly crude biometric data you have on Jethro Bornanew.

Nile Virens himself, however, awaits you in a cell.

More than anything, Nile Virens looks tired. Not surprised; he seems to have been expecting you. But tired.

His fine suit, hand sewn from the looks of it, is ripped and dirty. A medic has applied some derm patches; you've already been briefed on his status. Minor lacerations, contusions; nothing serious.

options: lke_virensRaidWhoTold:"Who told you I'm looking for Jethro Bornanew."
lke_virensRaidGetTea:"Guard, get this man some tea."
lke_virensRaidWalked:"It looks like I just walked all over your 'path', huh."
lke_virensRaidToBusiness:"So you're not going to call me a servant of Moloch? Spawn of Mammon?"
lke_virensRaidNotPather:"You don't sound like much of a Pather."
lke_virensRaidCotton2:"I need to speak with Brother Cotton. To give him a message."
lke_virensRaidCotton3:"Send him a message. Tell him I need to meet with him."

text:
A quiet minute passes while some tea is retrieved. Virens stares at you, and you at him.

The guard sets a pot, and two cups down. Virens lifts his hands - bound in a restraint cuff - to the table.
options:
lke_virensRaidTeaA:Pour the tea.
lke_virensRaidTeaB:Let him pour.
lke_virensRaidTeaC:"Guard, remove those cuffs."

text:
Virens closes his eyes for a long moment, like this is making him even more tired.

"You. You did. You asked everyone on Mazalot where to find Jethro Bornanew."

He opens his eyes again. "When the captain of an independent $shipOrFleet comes to Mazalot and asks for someone, I hear of it. Especially after they've done the same thing on Chalcedon."

He smirks wearily.

"Yes," he says, "I can see that all too well, Captain $playerName. You appear to believe that I have him stashed away somewhere."

He smirks, though his eyes remain fixed on yours with... yes, that looks like rage long-suppressed, held in a little ball; a spark to light fires for years and years.

"Captain $playerName. I can see that you are not unaccustomed to the use of force. I am not so young a man as I was and have found I have little patience for theater when it comes to matters of... business."

"You want Jethro Bornanew. You believe that I have him working for me, or I've kidnapped him for some purpose."

You pour tea in the two cups.

"Blessed peace upon us," Virens says, his voice thick with irony. "I accept your hospitality, and the welcome of your home."

He lifts his cuffed hands to awkwardly pour tea in the two cups, one after the other.

"Blessed peace upon us," Virens says, his voice thick with irony. "I offer my hospitality, and the welcome of my home: Mazalot, world of dust."

The guard moves to Virens, holds the cuffs, and gives a nod to the guard watching through the surveillance feed. A remote command unlocks the cuffs. The guard pulls the cuffs away. Virens wrists are deeply bruised.

He rubs them, eyes still fixed on you.
He uses the cuffs to shove one tea cup toward you, and takes the other in his hands and lifts it, a splash escaping onto the table.
Virens picks up his tea cup. His grip is unsteady, and he splashes some tea onto his hand and the table.
He blows on the tea and takes a sip.

The tea is very hot, and not very good. Some concoction of genmod yeasts grown in a vat spinning around some Persean world or other.

Virens matches your action and shows no sign of noticing the quality of the tea.
"No."

"I see no need to perform for you, captain."

He sighs, "You want Jethro Bornanew, I want to return to my home. Let us speak of business."

This he didn't expect. He looks at you, searching, now.

"I know of him," he says. "I would not say I know him. If you are looking for him, I will not be of much use. We... follow different Paths."

Virens shrugs awkwardly, the cuffs restraining his movement.

"As I said, Livewell Cotton is no associate of mine, nor am I a packet-carrier. I have ways of sending him messages, and I can do so if that is what you demand."

Virens shrugs.

"As I said, Livewell Cotton is no associate of mine. Nor am I a packet-carrier. I do have ways of sending him messages, and I can do so if that is what you demand."
"It shall bring me great pleasure to do so," Virens says, the bilious undercurrent impossible to miss, "upon my return to what is left of my home."

"I believe I can answer your questions," Virens says, "If you would allow me to explain the situation."

He clears his throat, ending in an uncomfortable cough, then begins. "Bornanew came to this world asking about the Luddic Path. He had asked similar questions on Chalcedon."
options:
lke_virensRaidJethro2a:"He met with Sedge."
lke_virensRaidJethro3:Let him tell it

text: He raises an eyebrow. "Yes. He met with Sedge. I did not know this when he came here, but it was soon confirmed by my people."

He raises an eyebrow. "Yes. He met with Sedge. The man you shot in the back, in a teahouse catering to spacers."

Virens doesn't seem to infuse his last words with any particular judgment.

He raises an eyebrow. "Yes. He met with Sedge. The man you... saw dead in the alley behind a teahouse catering to spacers."

Virens doesn't seem to infuse his last words with any particular judgment.
"I invited Bornanew for tea." He pauses, "You could learn much from the hospitality of the Luddic Faithful."
"I invited Bornanew for tea." He pauses, "My hospitality was not quite like yours. We do things differently among the Faithful."
"I invited Bornanew for tea." He pauses, "Much like you have invited me, though I must confess that my 'invitation' was gentler by far."

"Anyway; we spoke. He told me why he came to Mazalot - the real reason - and who sent him." He gives you a moment to take that in. "I did not offer him employment in any respect. Nor, as it happens, did he want it."
"We come now to the crux of our dealing, captain. I know where Bornanew went next. I am willing to tell you, provided you give me my freedom."
options:
lke_virensRaidJethroFree:"Agreed. Bornanew for your freedom." (truth)
lke_virensRaidJethroLie:"Agreed. Bornanew for your freedom." (lie)

text: In response, Virens drops his cuffed hands on the table with a clunk. He looks to you expectantly.
notes: # not wasting time quibbling about this

text:
He nods slowly, watching your face.

He rubs his bruised wrists. "I don't know the coordinates by heart. I shall need a datapad and a standard map of Mazalot."
options:
lke_virensRaidJethroFree2a:"Guard, get a datapad."
lke_virensRaidJethroFree2b:Pull out your personal datapad

text: You tell him he'll go free, and he is a fool to trust you.

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 Jethro Bornanew 的位置" highlight
unset $global.lke_contactVirens
$global.lke_contactBornanew = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
$option = lke_virensRaidJethroFree3 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
He takes the datapad and manipulates the digital map with skill born of familiarity.

After but a moment, he pushes the datapad back across the table to you. A marker has been set on a blur outside of a minor settlement in the southern hemisphere; some homestead. The Luddic settlers did not see fit to submit their names to the Mazalot Unification Authority's survey, so it is named only by a code assigned by a software interpreter.

"That is where he went after we spoke. My watchers in the transport hub have not seen him leave the municipality," he shrugs at this; there are other modes of transport, of course.

"You should speak with Bornanew."

options:
lke_virensRaidJethroFreeEnd3:"Guard, take Virens to a shuttle."
lke_virensRaidJethroEndThanks:"Thank you."
lke_virensRaidJethroForAPather:"For a Pather, you turn remarkably easily."
lke_virensRaidJethroNotSoBad:"That wasn't so hard."

text: He simply stares at you as if this isn't worth a response.
He sighs impatiently. "Your vision is narrow, I'm afraid. And I shall not be the man to correct it."
He crosses his arms. "I am no use to my people dead."
"Wait!" Virens tries to stand, "We had a deal."
options:
lke_virensRaidJethroLie2a:Shoot him
lke_virensRaidJethroLie2d:"You're going free... into the custody of the MUA. Guard, take Virens to a shuttle."
lke_virensRaidJethroLie2c:Reconsider your lie

script:
$player.ethosRuthless++
$global.shotVirens = true
SetPersonHidden virens true
$option = lke_virensRaidEnd 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
He sees your weapon and relaxes. Like he understands what you're doing, and accepts it.

It's over in a moment.
It might be useful to have a Pather that understands both your power and your mercy.
options:
lke_virensRaidJethroFreeEnd3:"Guard, take Virens to a shuttle."
lke_virensRaidJethroForAPather:"For a Pather, you turn remarkably easily."
lke_virensRaidJethroNotSoBad:"That wasn't so hard."
lke_virensRaidJethroLie2b:"You're going free... into the custody of the MUA. Guard, take Virens to a shuttle."
lke_virensRaidJethroLie2a:No. Draw your sidearm and shoot him.

text: He looks confused for a moment, and then suppresses a smile.

"I apologize, captain. I should not make light of your mercy." 

He clears his throat, "It is a strange Path that I have been given. That is all."

"I apologize, captain. I should not make light of your mercy."

He pauses, then "But as your guest... the MUA cannot charge me, and cannot hold me. It would cause such chaos. They will release me."

"But it doesn't end there."

"I will thank them for their mercy; they will extend the hand of compromise. You'll be the great enemy, they the peacemakers."

He looks apologetic, "It won't happen for sure, but when Providence provides, those who truly love God leap to seize it. By the end of this, it is I who might be thanking you."

Virens is escorted to a shuttle with orders that he handed over to the highest ranking officer of the MUA that can be found. He'll be their problem now.

You return to your command center.

Virens 被护送至一架穿梭机且你命令下属将他在他们最终到达的着陆台上释放。你确信他会有办法离开的。

你回到了你的指挥中心。

script:
#Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE

text: You leave the brig and return to your command center.

options: 2:lke_bornanewVisitPlan:乘坐一架穿梭机前往 Bornanew 的坐标。

text:
Your sensors officer and analysis team perform a thorough scan of the coordinates given to you by Nile Virens.

The location is a lightly populated, poorly developed rural zone on the far fringe of one of the more unremarkable Luddic-majority settlements. The land is nearly barren and bereft of valuable mineral deposits.

Orbital imaging shows a small, struggling farmstead close to the coordinates given. An individual human appears to be present, though it would require observation over a greater time period to fully establish an accurate count of inhabitants. There are also what appear to be a collection of burial sites near the farmstead.

"At least," your sensors officer reports, "that's what it appears to be. Weapons, people; many things can be hidden. Especially with the interference caused by this magnetic field..."
You order a shuttle prepared for descent to the coordinates provided to you by Nile Virens.
options:
lke_bornanewShuttle1:Take the shuttle to the surface
lke_bornanewVisitScan:Order a scan of Bornanew's coordinates
lke_prepMarines:Bring a squad of marines as backup
lke_bornanewAbort:Scrub the launch and consider your options

script:
SetTooltip lke_prepMarines "Requires at least 6 marines."
SetTooltipHighlights lke_prepMarines 6
SetEnabled lke_prepMarines false

text:
You order a half-dozen of your most experienced marines to don surface warfare stealth-op gear.

Their outer suits shimmer and rustle, and six sleek black marines in light armor transform before you into a dusty haze, like a fiery, killing wind of divine vengeance out of some ancient Luddic myth.

You have to but whisper the code-phrase and they will perform a rapid assault to secure your position from most forms of military equipment available on Mazalot.

The spectra of charged particles interacting with Mazalot's atmosphere flare and break like ocean waves.

Your shuttle's descent is smooth, your pilot interfacing with the lackadaisical local traffic control and receiving only token objection to landing near a Luddic-majority settlement.

"Near" is a relative term, of course; you're well over the horizon from all but a half-dozen of the prefab hab units that have been dragged out here and modified by their inhabitants. Half of those appear to be abandoned, the surrounding fields rippled with dust.
Your shuttle lands, kicking up a cloud that wafts outward in a diminishing wave over a desolation of erratic boulders and ashy-looking trees.
Your shuttle lands, and in a blur your marine squad fans out into the surrounding plain, a desolation of erratic boulders and ashy-looking trees.

Before you is a modified prefab hab. A corroded, leaking irrigation system shudders unsteadily as it tends to an unhealthy-looking garden grid. The adjacent crop field is quite dead.

On the flight in, the shuttle sensors tagged a living human figure in the sheltered grove nearby.

You follow a path toward the grove. Protected from the parching winds by a low rise, it seems that the trees planted here collect almost enough moisture to survive.

A new run of ceramolith pipe follows the trail to the grove. Like someone wanted to water the trees.

You follow a path toward the grove. Sheltered from the dry winds by a low rise, it seems that the trees planted here collect almost enough moisture to survive. But not quite.

Your marines whisper tactical call-and-response in your ear. "$PlayerSirOrMadam," the squad leader addresses you personally, "Target ID confirmed; visual match with Bornanew. Appears unarmed."

script:
Call $global.lke_ref playMusicJethro
AddStoryPoints 1
BeginConversation bornanew
$player.metBornanew = true
FireAll LKEjethroOptions
text:
The shade of the grove is speckled by light filtering through thin leaves.

You find a large man in a long, dusty hooded coat, almost a robe. His back is to you.

There are a handful of Luddic grave-markers here; brightly painted with natural pigments. These look well maintained. 

The man's head is bowed, his hands clasped in prayer.

options: lke_jethroC:"I'm taking you back to Gilead."
lke_jethroWhat:"What happened with infiltrating the Path? You had a mission."
lke_jethroWhy:"Why does Jaspis want you back so badly?
lke_jethroDead:"If you like, I can have found you dead here."
lke_jethroAngels:"Wait- what was that about the 'song of angels'?"

text:
"Oh, um." He looks at you to see if you're really asking this, now. You are.

"There are... writings around Ludd. From the early disciplines, recorded later. They tend to be heavily, ah, corrected in accordance with the Church's rulings in accordance with Ludd's wishes. Or what is known of them. Others, unofficial copies, have been created by con-artists and heretics to prove their own schemes and cults. These, the Knights purge. Some are kept as examples. For teaching; heretic-finding."

He shakes his head, "Anyway. The song of angels."
"To put it crudely, in some accounts it is said that God spoke to the Prophet Ludd through... through singing only Ludd could hear."

options: lke_jethroAngelsTalkA2:"It sounds like a neurological issue."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkB:"There was a time I heard... distant music. Like a choir."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkB:"I have heard... distant music. Like a choir. Wasn't in telemetry."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkC:"It's been said that Brother Livewell Cotton hears music. 'A choir of angels', those were the words."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkD:"Brother Livewell Cotton told me he has heard music. A 'choir of angels', he said."

text: "To be so blessed must be a burden beyond all knowing," Bornanew says grimly.

"It could," Bornanew says, and looks to you. "Where between madness and the divine stands a prophet?"

"-On uneasy ground," he finishes; quoting something with a hint of a smile.
"It is not the time for theology," Bornanew says agreeably.
He raises an eyebrow at you.

options: lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellZig:"I heard the music when we encountered a strange ship. It used exotic technologies unknown to even the Domain."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates:"I heard the music when we scanned the Gates, the Domain Gates, using a new method."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellZigOrbit:"That ship, the Ziggurat, is in orbit. In my fleet."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOmen:"What am I supposed to do with a 'fearful omen'?"
lke_jethroAngelsPOLa:"Walk the Path of Light? That doesn't help."
lke_jethroAngelsPOLb:"I will try to walk the path of light. When the time comes."
lke_jethroAngelsPOLc:"'Path of light'? Brother Cotton told me the same thing."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOut:"Let us speak of other things."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOut:"Never mind. It's not important now."

text: "I apologize," he says. "After you came all this way, I have only the words of a novice to offer you. No great secrets or wisdom."
"I pray for your strength," he says.
"Truly?" Bornanew shakes his head, "Now it is I who is tested by a fearful omen."
"That sounds like a fearful omen," Bornanew says earnestly.
Almost unconsciously he looks up to the sky, and says "Ludd's grace preserve us."

He lets out a sigh.

"Reason as well as life are gifts of the Creator. We are tested by confrontation with divine mystery. We must decide if we follow the highest path, or merely the most convenient."

He speaks more quietly, "It is a test. When the time comes, will you walk the path of light?"

"The doctrine of the Church tells us the Gates are a product of technological sin. I'm sure you know this," Bornanew says, watching you carefully. "Ludd's words, as far as we know them, do not put it quite so simply."

options:
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2A2:"I have traversed the Gates. A lesser crossing, but I have the technology."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2a:"The Gates are a gift, Bornanew. We should use them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2b:"The Gates are dangerous. They must be studied carefully."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2d:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2c:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them." (lie)

text: "Then I beg Providence save us," Bornanew almost whispers. "I know not what door you have opened."

options:
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2a:"The Gates are a gift, Bornanew. We should use them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2b:"The Gates are dangerous. They must be studied carefully."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2d:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2c:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them." (lie)

text: "I admit, captain, that I cannot but look upon this gift with suspicion when the bones of the Domain lie moldering around us."
"One must be careful around great and terrible works such as the Gates. Even your science suggests that observation may change both subject and observer."
"Just as well, then. But I suspect few of the great factions share your intent."
"Just as well, then," Bornanew says, as if you've both just agreed to not discuss something. "I suspect the great factions will do little to avoid them."
"Of course. It is not now the time for theology," Bornanew says, watching you carefully.
"He would not be the first to make that claim," Bornanew says. "Nor the last, I am sure. God save us if Cotton were a prophet."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "Yes. I am Jethro Bornanew."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "No," he says. He glances back at the graves. "This farm - what's left of it - they built it. So I was told."

"No," he says, looking at the graves. "I never met them. Not when they were alive, I mean."

"This farm - what's left of it - they built it. So I was told."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you, a hint of concern on his face. "I see. The Reverend Archcurate. Of course."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "Of course."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you, a hint of concern on his face. "I see. Jaspis, of course."
He looks over your uniform, then past you toward the ridgeline. "You came a long way. Captain, I assume?"

He looks over your uniform, then past you toward the ridgeline.

"You came a long way. And you brought warriors." He turns back to the graves, "I've counted two, so far."

"It is." He looks down at the graves. "It was."

"I've discovered that I'm a poor farmer, captain. It seems like everything withers at my touch."
He gives you a strange look. "If you really want to, I suppose."
options:
lke_jethroJeffA:"Jeff it is. More efficient."
lke_jethroJeffB:"Jeff it is. It's less... you know."
lke_jethroJeffC:"I'm not being serious. Your name is Jethro."

text: "Less Luddic, you mean," he says with a smirk. "I understand."
"Less Luddic," he says with a smirk. "I understand."

"Ah," he smiles awkwardly. 

"I apologize. This is all... not a shock, exactly. A rather big turn on the path that I have found to be my life, I suppose. It is a lot to reflect upon, now that it is happening."

"I failed," he says.

After a moment, he speaks again, "And I confess, I wanted to fail. After meeting the recruiter on Chalcedon..." Bornanew shakes his head.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedge:"Sedge?"
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"Sedge? Don't worry, I killed him."

text:
"I failed," he says.

After a moment, he speaks again, "And I confess, I wanted to fail. After meeting the recruiter on Chalcedon..." Bornanew shakes his head.

"Yes," he looks surprised, "That was his name. I did not like the man. I did not like the things I would have to do to make him like me."

Bornanew looks away, "He seemed to be someone I might have been if I had lived a different life. Walked a different path."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"Don't worry, I killed Sedge."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"The deed is done. Or not done, in your case. Let it go."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"But you're not him. That's why Jaspis wants you back."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"You'll have to learn to be a lot less squeamish if you're to be a Knight."

text:
"You- what?" He looks you in the eyes, to confirm that you are telling the truth. He quickly discovers that you are.

"I have no words," he says, shaking his head.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledA:"Aren't you a Knight Initiate? How can you be so squeamish?"
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledB:"Don't worry about it."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledC:"You could try 'thank you'."

text:
"I might not be when I get back," he admits.

"But you're right. It is probable that a Knight will be called upon to kill to defend the Faith. It is what I agreed to, what I swore I would learn."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"Look, this one was on me. Don't worry about it."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text:
"I feel that I must," he says. "In one sense, his death is due to my choices, though I had no way of knowing it."

"It is true also that he was, by all accounts - and indeed in my judgment - an evil man. His faith twisted in upon itself. It shielded him from remorse for his... actions."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"You're worrying about it. I told you not to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text:
"I cannot do that," he says.

"I do concede that he was, by all accounts and indeed my judgment, an evil man. His faith, it was twisted in upon itself. It shielded him from remorse for his... actions."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"... You're welcome."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text: "I cannot do that," he says.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"... You're welcome."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text: He nods hesitantly, and says "Then I will speak no further on this matter."
He gives you a skeptical look, "That worries me all the more."
"Your words are a cold comfort, captain."

"The Reverend Archcurate," he says automatically.

"Sorry," he adds quickly. "Habit. They really drill it into you in the Church. Archcurate Jaspis... told me I could call her Sophronia, as if I was family."

"She wants to change the path of the Faith, I believe. She believes I can help her do it."

options: lke_jethroWhyOptB:"People died for me to find you."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"I shot a man to find you."
lke_jethroWhyOptD:"No one else seems to think much of you."

text:
"So was Ludd," he says, and laughs. 

"Ah," he catches himself, and wipes his eyes. "Forgive me my blasphemy. I do not believe I am Ludd; I do not hear God's word in the songs of angels."
He sighs deeply. "Was it necessary?"
options:
lke_jethroWhyOptBnotImp:"That's not important now. I have a mission to complete."
lke_jethroWhyOptByes:"Yes. In conflicts between the powerful, that's how it works."
lke_jethroWhyOptBno:"No. I may have overreacted."

text: "Gilead," he says, staring at the graves.
He looks at you uneasily, but says nothing.
"I see," he looks at you uneasily.

He shrugs. "The Reverend Archcurate does. And that was enough to bring you here, for me."

He glances over at you, "I don't care to speculate about how many credits she's wasting on me."

"Yes," he says and glances at you. Expecting some news of Jaspis' health, maybe. He turns away again.

"Time comes for us all. I expect she sees that. She wants to leave behind a world... that's better, I think."
options:
lke_jethroWhyOptEa:"An admirable cause."
lke_jethroWhyOptEb:"A hopeless dream."
lke_jethroWhyOptEc:Say nothing.

text: He grunts acknowledgement, looking down at the brightly painted graves.
He doesn't respond. Just looks down at the brightly painted graves.

He quickly turns to stare at you with a strange intensity. "I-," he begins, and his words catch in his throat. He breathes heavily for a moment, almost unsteady on his feet.

"No," he says. "I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
options:
lke_jethroDeadHopelessA:"Feeling okay?"
lke_jethroDeadHopelessB:Give him a moment
lke_jethroDeadHopelessC:"Don't die for real on me, now."

text: "No," he says, then "Yes, I mean. I'm fine. Just, the answer is no. I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
"No," he says. "The answer is no. I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
He quickly turns to stare at you with a strange intensity. "I-," he begins, and his words catch in his throat. He breathes heavily for a moment, almost unsteady on his feet.
options:
lke_jethroDead1a:"Feeling okay?"
lke_jethroDead1b:Give him a moment
lke_jethroDead1c:"Don't die for real on me, now."

text:
After a moment, he lets a breath out, and then almost - but not quite - casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Yes. Yes, I am well. Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

He lets a breath out, and then almost casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Forgive me," he clears his throat. "Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

After a moment, he lets a breath out, and then almost - but not quite - casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Yes. Yes, I am well. Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

options:
lke_jethroDeadOut1:"Yes. Just say the word."
lke_jethroDead3a:"Of course. I just need a body to substitute." (look pointedly at the graves)
lke_jethroDead3b:"I afraid I cannot. The Archcurate gave me a mission and I intend to complete it."

text:
"No," he says with a sudden ferocity.

He catches himself, then begins again, more calmly, 
"And no, forget about all of that. I'm coming with you to Gilead. I have to."
"Of course," he says quietly. "I have a duty; I made a promise."

He looks, struck silent, at the light coming through the trees.

"Let someone else walk my path."

He turns to you. "I accept. Tell Jaspis... tell her... I should write something, maybe..."
options:
lke_jethroDeadOut2b:"No. You must live for yourself now."
lke_jethroDeadOut2a:"You should. It will help. She was... emotional."

text:
He sighs, covering his face with his hands. "I can't do this. I'm sorry."

"I have a duty. I made a promise. It's what I have to do."

"But..." he falls silent.

In a long minute, he appears to accept your words.
"This is it then," he turns and looks at you once more.
options:
lke_jethroDeadOut3a:"It is. Burn bright, burn long." (leave)
lke_jethroDeadOut3b:"It is. Blessed be your path." (leave)
lke_jethroDeadOut3c:"It is. Keep your head down." (leave)

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.jethroName = Jethro
$global.lke_foundBornanew2 = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
You walk from the graves, from the dry grove, and return to your shuttle, and it returns you to your $shipOrFleet.

Jethro Bornanew - the man who was once called Jethro Bornanew - is a free man now. Free of his oath, free of schemes; free to live his next life, whatever it may be.

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.jethroName = Jethro
$global.lke_foundBornanew2 = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
You walk from the graves, from the dry grove. Your marine squad falls in like spirits of the desert summoned to material form.

Jethro Bornanew - the man who was once called Jethro Bornanew - is a free man now. Free of his oath, free of schemes; free to live his next life, whatever it may be.

Finding a body to substitute for Bornanew is not difficult. One that appears to have died a violent death, but at least a quick death?

Shot in the back by a Pather seems likely, but too dramatic. An accident, then; even easier. A thruster malfunction at the docks. Over in a split second, and no one really to blame except slipshod safety/control measures. One of those unhappy little events that Providence provides to bring an unexpected end to the path of life... and which burns away obvious identifying features.

The Reverend Archcurate will accept a closed-casket burial, you think.

text:

"There's nothing here I need," Bornanew says as you pause before the dying farmstead. "I am prepared to leave."

The shuttle returns you to your $shipOrFleet.

text:
