AddTextSmall "ANDRADA-ACHILLES" highlight
AddTextSmall "ANDRADA-LEONIDAS" highlight
AddTextSmall "ANDRADA-PERICLES" highlight

text:
"It's hard to say," your tech officer looks hestitant. "I mean, Andrada. A list of names? I'd say family of some kind, but it doesn't match anything in the public demography file on Philip Andrada."

"But um, it comes down to the metadata. If you examine that, all of the encrypted archives were created over a period of about a month back in cycle 182. And then all them except ANDRADA-PERSEUS have been updated within the last week or so."

"Or what didn't happen," your tech officer glances up, and, nervous at being seen as impertinent, quickly continues. 

"Perseus was last updated near the end of cycle 205. As if, well, as if a telemetry feed stopped. Or lost contact."

script:
Call $global.sdtu_ref makeDerbisUnimportant
$global.sdtu_deliverNews = true
Call $global.sdtu_ref updateStage
unset $global.sdtu_emergencyIntercept
Call $global.sdtu_ref makeMercHostile
text:
技术主管点头认同了你的言外之意。

"我会扔一些标准破解器去试一下解密，但理论上在宇宙终结之前它都不可能被破解。如果你想查阅这些文件的话，我们还需要另找些门路才行。"

您已备份所制作的文件。

Macario 到底把手伸进了什么地方？

通讯链接打开。

"独立舰队，"雇佣兵带着无聊的专业语气说道。"我已签约执行一项仍在进行中的行动。你必须立即离开这片区域。"

options: sdtu_mercSDCom1:"你处于 辛达强权 的星区内！我才是在这下命令的人 。"
sdtu_mercReact1meetShip:"我在这等待一艘船或者一支舰队。"
sdtu_mercReact1debris:"我必须调查那个残骸区。"

text:
The mercs eyebrows raise and $heOrShe takes a moment to refer to a secondary display as if to confirm your claim.

"I see," $heOrShe says. "Very inconvenient. Nonetheless, I must insist."
$HeOrShe停顿了一下，然后小心地说："我...请求...你们远离附近的残骸区，直到它散去。"

"Mm," $heOrShe looks just a touch uncomfortable.

"Then I would suggest that waiting around will not be a productive use of time."
"啊，"$heOrShe皱起眉头。"我的任务要求我不能透露雇主的身份。里头有巨额惩罚条款。"
"Burn bright... and far," $heOrShe says.

"你不能，"雇佣兵眼睛一眨不眨地说。

"我现在要告诉你，我的任务是使用致命武力确保残骸不被触碰。"
options:
sdtu_mercReact1onMyWay:"那么我马上就离开。"
sdtu_mercUseForce:"那就用武力来阻止我。"

script:
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile sdtu true
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
text:
雇佣兵叹了一口气，闭上了$hisOrHer的眼睛。"你让我陷入了一个艰难的境地，更糟糕的是我可能会付出非常昂贵的代价，舰长。"

"请不要向任何人提及这件事。"

通讯链接中断了。你的战术副官通知你雇佣兵的舰队似乎正在离开。
"随你便。"雇佣兵说道，然后切断了通信链接。

$HeOrShe将一根手指放在$hisOrHer耳边，然后坐了起来，好像$heOrShe被告知了一些重要的事情。"等等，你是$playerName。 霸主 的雇佣辅助军？"

"抱歉，舰长。我接到的具体指令要求我不干扰你的行动，而且，"$heOrShe仔细检查了一个数据平板，"看来我要，嗯，提供援助，只要不影响我的任务。"
options:
sdtu_mercHegReact1whatDoing:"你在干什么？"
sdtu_mercHegReact1meetShip:"我在这等待一艘船或者一支舰队。"
sdtu_mercHegReact1whoWork:"你为谁工作？"
sdtu_mercHegReact1onMyWay:"我现在就离开。"

text:
"My apologies, but my orders are to not provide operational information to any outside party except insofar as is required to carry out the mission. Though, of course, your status confers something of a loophole..."

$HeOrShe thinks for a moment. "I have attacked and destroyed a few ships that my employer wished destroyed. I am to ensure there are no survivors, and allow no rescue attempt."

"嗯，"$heOrShe看起来很不舒服。"如果你在等待我刚刚摧毁的小舰队中的某个人，那会让我们处于一个有点尴尬的境地。"

"赚钱嘛，不寒碜。...我希望你们之间不是很亲密吧?"雇佣兵尴尬地耸耸肩。

"Ah," $heOrShe frowns. "I am specifically required to not identify my employer. Mission parameters, you see."

The merc winks, "But I'm sure a clever captain could infer important facts due to the disposition I've been ordered to show toward a Hegemony-commissioned captain."

"And I must say," $heOrShe stretches and lets out a sigh. "The nightlife at Ragnar Complex is rather a disappointment."

script:
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile sdtu true
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
text:
The merc $post makes the vac-ops 'all safe' sign with $hisOrHer hand.

"Bright burns and profitable runs."

id: # SDTU step 10: Return to Macario with Big News, seriously, the last time.

script:
BeginConversation macario true true
Call $global.sdtu_ref endMusic
Call $global.sdtu_ref updateData
text:
He wastes no time with greetings or posturing.

"I would not be so naive to ask you to delete your copy of this data," Macario says with inhuman calm. "I'm sure your people are quite capable of creating a thorough charade of compliance."
options:
sdtu_newsEndWhat:"What happened to Perseus?"
sdtu_newsEndWho:"Who are these seven Andradas?"
sdtu_newsEndHeirs:"Are these the heirs of Andrada? Only six left."
sdtu_newsEndYourDoing:"I appreciate you not wasting my time. So was Perseus your doing?"
sdtu_newsEndSale:"My silence is very much for sale."

text: Macario stares unblinking. "Have I so underestimated you?"
"Andrada, of course." Macario simply raises an eyebrow, "I thought that was obvious."
"On so few the future hangs, captain," Macario says hollowly, unblinking.
"悲剧，" Macario 不假思索地说。"不是吗。"
"You wound me with the accusation, captain," Macario says with a hint of cold amusement.
"Naturally," Macario says, taking a moment to tap at a datapad.

"There will come a time soon when decisions must be made, dear captain," he takes a moment to tap at a datapad.

"I trust you have gained some appreciation for my... generous leadership style."
options:
sdtu_returnNewsEndLoyal:"What are you loyal to, Macario?"
sdtu_returnNewsEndHull:"You mentioned 'experimental ship hull' in a previous conversation..."

text:
"Did I?" He chuckles. "Mercenary to the end eh? I'll have arrangements made."

"I am so pleased that you value what I can provide. This will be important, and soon."

"Power, of course. I'm just like you."

 He slowly rubs his hands together, watching.

"Don't bother denying it."

script:
AddXP $sdtu_xpRewardHigh
AddStoryPoints 1
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
Call $global.sdtu_ref resumeMusic
$global.sdtu_completed = true
Call $global.sdtu_ref updateStage
ShowDefaultVisual
text:
His eyes open wide, "Don't you see it, captain? I have no need to emblazon my face upon history! Merely... " he grows quiet, "Mm, to direct it. Correct it. Trim the loose ends which hold us back, tie us down."

"That is all captain," he says, re-asserting a mask of calm. "For now. I'm sure we shall speak again soon."

The comms cut to the crest of the Sindrian Diktat internal security ministry.

id: # SDTU during and post, misc convos

# go to SD characters section. 
# Is anything else actually needed here, to make sense?
# anh - A New Hope aka Passage to Volturn

script: AddBarEvent anh_cantinaAsk "See what the old man wants" "You see an old man followed by a kid and a chunky robot trying to talk to some of the seedier-looking space captains."

BeginConversation robed_man
BeginMission anh false
Call $global.anh_ref updateData
$player.metANHRobedMan = true
FireAll anhCantinaAskHubOptions
$option = anh_cantinaAsk0
FireAll anhCantinaAskHubOptions
text:
The old man looks like a hermit who's been living out in the wastes for countless cycles. His robes are dusty, his skin creased and tanned.

He smiles mysteriously as you approach, and speaks both to you and the mop-haired kid, more a youth of not yet 20 cycles.

"I have a good feeling about this one."

options: anh_cantinaAskTransport:"Let me guess- you need transport, no need to involve the authorities."
anh_cantinaAskFeelings:"I'd be careful about trusting your feelings around here, old man."
anh_cantinaRobot:"机器人又是怎么回事，里面有什么 AI 吗？"
anh_cantinaKnowMore0:"如果你真是什么恐怖分子，那别和我扯上关系。"
anh_cantinaKnowMore:"如果你真是什么恐怖分子，让我开开眼。"
anh_cantinaChargeMore:"如果你真是什么恐怖分子，那得加钱。"
anh_cantinaDeny:"这份工作对我来说是个烫手山芋。找其他舰长吧。"
anh_cantinaDeny:"这不值得我花时间。找其他人吧。"

text: "你说的对，舰长。" 老人说，"抵达 Askonia 星系的 Volturn 后，你将获得 10,000 星币的报酬。正如你所说：我们应该避开任何巡逻队或检查。"
options:
anh_cantinaAccept:"那就这么定了。"
anh_cantinaAuthorities:"为什么当局会那么想抓到你们？"

text:
年轻人开始说话，"因为那是 ——" 老人举起一根手指警告，让孩子停止讲话。

"只是一些大多数人已经忘记的旧历史。我认为你最好不要问。"
老人与孩子交换了个眼神，而孩子看起来很担忧。"我不觉得我们看起来像恐怖分子，你觉得呢？"
老人的笑容又回来了，就像他预料到你会这么说一样。

老人点点头，仿佛他预料到了这一点。孩子看起来很生气，"这么多星币，够我们买一艘旧船了！我打赌我很快就能让它飞起来，然后我们就 ——" 老人举手让他安静。

"抵达后我可以支付给你 17,000 星币。" 他平静地说，"不能再多。"

孩子交叉双臂，生着闷气。

"They led you to me, did they not?" he says, as if it means anything.

The kid gets a look of awe, eating this line up like ancient wisdom.
options:
anh_cantinaAskFeelings1:"Sure, whatever."
anh_cantinaAskFeelings2:"I suppose they did."

text: 老者没有说话，嘴角挂着一抹笑意。孩子在你和老人之间来回看了看，等待接下来会发生什么。
"你不用担心这些小东西们。" 老人说道。
options:
anh_cantinaRobot1:"我也不必担心它。"
anh_cantinaRobot2:"可是，我确实需要知道那玩意是否安全。"

text: 老人满意地点点头。

The kid finds his tongue. "Of course it's safe! We bought it from some scavengers and then I took it apart and put it back together myself." 

It sounds like he's been holding back an outburst this whole time.

"I can fix anything!" he adds.
options:
anh_cantinaRobot3:"Sure. If I need some farm equipment repaired I'll let you know."
anh_cantinaRobot4:"I could use a junior engineer in my fleet."
anh_cantinaRobot5:"So what's this about, old man?"

text:
This sets the kid off. 

"I'm not just some dune-farmer," the youth says, raising his voice, "I'm a great pilot just like-" the old man reaches out and touches him on the shoulder. The kid takes the hint.

"What my young friend means to say is that we have another task in mind."

The youth is taken aback by this respect granted to him by a space captain. He looks like he's actually thinking about it. "I can't, I mean thank you, but I'm a great pilot just like-" the old man reaches out, holding him back. 

"What my young friend means to say is that his destiny lies elsewhere."
"A simple run to Volturn. You'll be paid and then you can forget all about us," the old man says, his mysterious smile returning.

The anger and disappointment on the kid's face is palpable. The old man puts a hand on his shoulder, with just a small motion diverting the rush of youthful emotion.

As you step away, you overhear the old man speaking softly, "There is another..."

You make arrangements for the old man, the youth, and their robot to be shuttled to your $shipOrFleet.

They don't seem especially dangerous. Surely no one in the Hegemony or Sindrian Diktat is putting much effort into tracking their movements.

script: SetStoryOption anh_diktatPatrolBluff general "Bluffed Sindrian Diktat patrol about charitably transporting sand farmers from Asharu"
text:
"Captain," the Sindrian Diktat officers says in a level tone, "We have reason to believe that you carry a terrorist known to the Sindrian Security Directorate."

$HeOrShe barely lifts a finger, and a supplementary data package is transmitted to you. Your comms officer attaches the contents to a secondary display: it's the old man from Asharu. Much younger in this looping holo, wearing the military uniform of some minor polity instead of robes.

"It would expedite my investigation if this individual found his way to my flagship." $HeOrShe smiles the coldest, smallest smile in the Sector.
options:
anh_diktatPatrolStall:"I'll need a moment to review my passenger manifest." (stall)
anh_diktatPatrolBluff:"I'm transporting a couple sand farmers. It's a charitable act."
anh_diktatPatrolRights:"You have no right to kidnap my passengers."
anh_diktatPatrolNope:"That isn't going to happen."
anh_patrolHostileEnd:Cut the comm link

text: The Diktat officer gives the barest nod. Your comms officer takes this as a cue to freeze the transmission.
In a briefing room, the old man watches the holo of his younger self with a wistful smile. The kid is there, looking terrified. Their robot beeps and performs some kind of idling cycle.
options:
anh_diktatPatrolStall3:"Care to explain?"
anh_diktatPatrolStall30:"I don't want to know."

text: Unfortunately the kid speaks up. "Wow, is that you? I knew it! You were part of-" The old man holds up a hand to stop the outburst. He closes his eyes.

"Now there's a man I have not seen in a long, long time," he says quietly. "By now, even I was starting to think he might be dead."

He looks to you now, a glimmer of that younger self appearing in his face. "Give me over to them, captain. The boy must go to Volturn without me. He will be safe if they have me."

The kid is aghast. "No!" he shouts, "They'll kill you!"
options:
anh_diktatPatrolStall3No:"I'm not handing anyone to the Diktat."
anh_diktatPatrolStall3Yes:"As you wish."
anh_diktatPatrolStall3All:"No, this ends here. I'm handing you all over."

text:
The old man looks more tired than surprised. 

The kid shouts, "Great! You can fight 'em off with your $shipOrFleet! I can help at the gunnery station, I'm a great shot. I promise I'll be careful and-"

You and the old man exchange a look. "Come, young one," the old man says, taking the youth by the shoulder. "We must let the good captain get to work."

"What!?" the kid shouts, "You can't do that. You have to fight! You have a $shipOrFleet! You're just going to let those Diktat goons order you around?" He lunges at you, and is bodily intercepted by the arm of one of your guards. After a yelp and a moment of struggle, the kid folds to an electrostun rod.

The old man does not give the commotion even a glance. Instead, his eyes are steady on yours. Looking deeply for something.

"He has so much to learn, $playerName." He looks thoughtful, "Fate may surprise us yet."

"What!?" the kid shouts, "You can't do that! You're just-" he lunges at you, and is bodily intercepted by the arm of one of your guards. After a yelp and a moment of struggle, the kid folds to an electrostun rod.

The old man does not give the commotion even a glance. Instead, his eyes are steady on yours. Looking deeply for something.

"So this is how you choose, $playerName." He looks thoughtful, "Fate may surprise us yet."

The Diktat officer looks less patient now, the polite smile barely a memory. 

"Captain," $heOrShe says in full knowledge of your lies, and knowing you know $heOrShe knows, "I trust you've thoroughly reviewed your passenger manifest."

options: anh_diktatPatrolOldMan:"I have someone of interest to transfer to your flagship, officer."
anh_patrolGiveUpBoth:"I have some persons of interest to transfer to your flagship, officer."

script: SetStoryOption anh_diktatPatrolBluff general "Bluffed Sindrian Diktat patrol about charitably transporting sand farmers from Asharu"
options: anh_diktatPatrolBluff:"I'm transporting a couple sand farmers. It's a charitable act."
anh_diktatPatrolRights:"You have no right to kidnap my passengers."

script: SetStoryOption anh_diktatPatrolBluff general "Bluffed Sindrian Diktat patrol about charitably transporting sand farmers from Asharu"
text:
The smile disappears, like it barely existed. 

"I see."

The Diktat officer turns away, motioning to $hisOrHer bridge crew, "In the name of the Supreme Executor I order you to power down your systems and prepare to be boarded," then looks back over $hisOrHer shoulder, and adds "Our search will be... thorough."
options:
anh_diktatPatrolNope:"No, that isn't going to happen."
anh_diktatPatrolBluff:"I'm transporting a couple sand farmers. It's a charitable act."
anh_diktatPatrolSearch:Allow the search

text:
The Diktat troopers sent to search your fleet seem more interested in bullying your crew and breaking delicate machinery than performing a legitimate search.

Your passengers are easily hidden, but you can tell by the expression on your engineering chief's face that serious damage has been done.

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson SUSPICIOUS -5
AdjustRep $personFaction.id SUSPICIOUS -2
Call $entity.anh_ref makeUnimportant
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
text: "All glory to the Lion of Sindria," $personRank $personLastName with a final smirk before severing the comm-link.

"Then," $heOrShe seems to find pleasure in $hisOrHer words for the first time, "You are resisting a lawful search performed under the authority of the Supreme Executor. A hostile act of terrorism against our dear Sindrian Diktat."
"These aren't the passengers I'm looking for," the Diktat officer repeats. A hint of disbelief slips out at the final word.

"Transporting sand farmers," the Diktat officer repeats, "For charity."

More than a hint of disbelief slips out at the final word.

Then anger cracks across $hisOrHer face, "That is the most preposterous lie I've ever-" 

A ping from the other bridge comes across the comms, interrupting the beginning of $hisOrHer tirade. The Diktat officer gives you a killing look then exchanges quiet words with some underlings; your comms officer gives you a tentative nod.

Your quick-thinking bridge crew has provided a fake manifest on your behalf, of course.

Of course they would have a plausible but misleading pre-generated crew and passenger manifest ready for just such a situation. If you offered it with enough confidence - and very little delay - it might just work.

You wait with saintly patience as the Diktat officer has an underling run the fake manifest through the latest Diktat search and verification algorithms.

script:
AddTextSmall "Delivered possible Volturnian Resistance member to the Sindrian Diktat" highlight
Call $entity.anh_ref makeUnimportant
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
AddCredits 8000
AdjustRepActivePerson FRIENDLY 5
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 2
$global.anh_handedOverRobedMan = true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
text:
The old man goes calmly to the shuttle for transfer.

"Your service to the Supreme Executor will be noted in the official records," the Diktat $personRank says as if $heOrShe is reading a script for $hisOrHer bridge crew. "Your loyalty to the Great Movement is commended, and the reward for turning in a known terrorist will now be transferred to your accounts."

$PersonRank $personLastName performs a bizarre salute and shouts something about "final victory"; your comms officer manages to extract you from the comms-link without further exchange.

script:
Call $entity.anh_ref makeUnimportant
AddCredits 15000
AdjustRepActivePerson FRIENDLY 10
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 3
$global.anh_handedOverEveryone = true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
text:
You have the old man and the kid transferred to the Sindrian Diktat flagship. They even want the robot "for evidence", so you have that old piece of junk sent as well.

"Your service to the Supreme Executor will be noted in the official records," $personRank $personLastName says like $heOrShe is reading a script for $hisOrHer bridge crew. "Your loyalty to the Great Movement is commended, and your reward for turning in a known terrorist and his accomplice will now be transferred."

$HeOrShe performs a bizarre salute and shouts something about "final victory"; your comms officer manages to extract you from the comm-link without further engagement.

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson SUSPICIOUS -10
AdjustRep $personFaction.id SUSPICIOUS -5
Call $entity.anh_ref makeUnimportant
$global.anh_diktatPatrolHostile = true
$ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 1
MakeOtherFleetHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAggressive true
text:
"We shall take no prisoners!" the Diktat officer shouts, "Those who harbor terrorists are themselves terrorists, and will be treated as-"

The link cuts out. Your comms officer gives you an apologetic look.

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson SUSPICIOUS -1
AdjustRep $personFaction.id SUSPICIOUS -1
Call $entity.anh_ref makeUnimportant
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
$global.anh_diktatPatrolBluffed = true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
text:
You hear an angry call of "Run it again!" that perhaps was not intended to get picked up by comms. It takes a few more minutes. 

"Very well," the Diktat officer says with what sounds like clenched teeth, "Your manifest has been verified. Technically."

With a sharp motion, $heOrShe signals to $hisOrHer comms to cut the link.

script:
AddTextSmall "Delivered possible Volturnian Resistance members to the Sindrian Diktat" highlight
$global.anh_completed = true
Call $global.anh_ref updateStage
text:
And that's the end of it. You start to wonder how things might have gone differently if you'd carried out the job and snuck what was clearly some kind of former military officer and his protege into contact with a faction of the Askonian underground... 

You call to navigation to lay in a new course.

你收到一条从某个明显非法的轨道中继器传来的通信，该通信为老人、小孩和他们的机器人指向了着陆点的方位。以及一笔匿名报酬的承诺。

当他们走下穿梭机的斜坡时，小孩惊呼道："哇，一个完全由水构成的星球！"
options:
anh_completeDeliveryMoon:"It's just a moon, kid. With a rocky core."
anh_completeDelivery:Let it go

text: The kid manages not to look disappointed at this revelation.

You receive a comms transmission from an obviously illicit orbital repeater which provides directions to a dropoff point for the kid, and their robot. And the promise of payment.

The kid walks sullenly down the shuttle's ramp, his loyal robot trundling behind. As he steps onto the rolling deckplates of Volturn, he looks back.

"Take care of yourself, I guess," he says. "That's what you're best at, isn't it."
options:
anh_completeDeliveryOnlyKid0:"We all do what we gotta do to survive, kid."
anh_completeDelivery:Let it go

script:
FireAll ANHRewardTrigger
$global.anh_completed = true
Call $global.anh_ref updateStage
$option = marketArrivalEventContinue 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
He looks like he's going to take the bait, but the robot bleeps at him, defusing his anger.

"Com'on, let's go," he says to his robot.
You're unable to safely deliver your passengers to Volturn right now.

script:
FireAll ANHRewardTrigger
$global.anh_completed = true
Call $global.anh_ref updateStage
$option = marketArrivalEventContinue 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text: The old man smiles and simply says, "Thank you, my friend," then turns up the hood of his robe and leads the strange party into the underworld of Volturn.

script:
AddTextSmall "Delivered reinforcements to the Volturnian Resistance?" highlight
AddCredits 17000
unset $global.anh_chargeMore

AddTextSmall "Delivered reinforcements to the Volturnian Resistance?" highlight
AddCredits 10000

options: umbra_warbossHelp1:"I want to help you fight the Diktat. What can I do?"

text:
"Oh, you're one of those? Easy! Just go kill some Sindies," with a laugh, $heOrShe mimes shooting a pistol.

"Any questions?"

Cydonia nods stiff-necked, the tiniest insinuation of a bow, then addresses you.

"See now how Captain $playerName crawls before her worshipfulness!" He turns slowly, projecting his piercing voice to all corners. "Safe under the protection of the merciless Warlord Kanta; safe like a little fetus in a birthing tank. See how those prosper who appease her desires!"

He spins back toward you. "Besides supplicating yourself before our queen of blood," he hisses, "Why have you come?"

Cydonia shakes his head slowly, arms crossed, looking down at you with showy disapproval.

He gives a shrill shout, "See this wretched worm before you!" Turning slowly to address all the court, he berates you. "This blind simpleton, this ungrateful fool. What madness compelled $playerName to throw off Kanta's gift of protection, given so dearly?"

The crowd boos and jeers, calling for your blood to spill on the agrav plates, or to boil away in the vaccuum as merciless as their queen. Cydonia looks pleased with himself. Kanta sits, impassive, respirators hissing like serpents coiled to strike.

Cydonia nods stiff-necked, the tiniest hint of a bow, then addresses you before the entire court.

"You've come crawling to her worshipfulness," he turns, projecting his piercing voice to all corners. "The mighty Warlord Kanta; the predator of the Persean Sector; the font of violence from which we quench our thirst for glory," then spins back toward you.

"Why are YOU here? Could you not protect your own outposts? Perhaps," he drops to almost a whisper, "it is something else."

"Captain $playerName! It is clear to me that you believe that all you do, from one end of the Sector to the other, is done in Kanta's name already!"

"Did you not claim to be working for our dear warlord?" The small man strains and sweats as he accuses you, "Did not her fear-inspiring name cross your lips... without her permission? Do you presume, captain, to know the will of our mighty-"

With the sound of grating metal, Cydonia's tirade is cut off. The Warlord Kanta stands up on armored mechanical legs. There's a thrashing, banging sound.

Laughter. That's what it is. Kanta's laughter like autocannon shell-cases dropping from an ejection port. Metal on metal, industrialized murder.

"Your presumption amuses us," Kanta's amplified voice booms out over the court, drowning out all else. "So eager to serve us, are you? Then we will make use of you."

Cydonia's mouth is a flat, twitching line.

"You dare return here $playerName!" shouts the strange doctor. "You stole Zal from us! Her clever little tinkerer, her asset, her prize." 

He seethes, almost hyperventilating, "H-how dare you!"

"You dare return here $playerName!" shouts the strange doctor, "After attacking the citadel of our warlord! Her home, her family! You stole Zal from us! Her clever little tinkerer, her asset, her prize." 

He seethes, almost hyperventilating, "H-how dare you!"

The court murmurs, heavy boots shuffle; you hear the distinct click-clank of a heavy kinetic round being chambered; it is inadvisable weapons handling practice within a sealed environment at the best of times. There is hatred among the pirates, you see, and Cydonia is stirring it against you.

Kanta's gauntlet slams against the side of her throne, crashing through the murmur of the court like thunder. Again she slams the throne, then once more, leaving only a painful echo.

Warlord Kanta speaks, like the voice of a heavy combat walker if it could speak, harmonics buzzing through your bones, "What tribute have you brought us? What gift will sate us?"

Cydonia leans in close, acidic breath wafting over you, "The warlord's protection is not easily gained. Do not offend her with unworthy dross," he hisses.

script:
$kpTried100k = true
SetEnabled kpGift100k false
AdjustRep pirates VENGEFUL -1
text:
"Paltry, plebeian, pathetic," Cydonia hisses at you, "A beggers sum, unworthy of the mighty Kanta!" he shouts, spittle flying.

The court shouts and jeers at your pitiable offer.

"Hm," the doctor ponders, then looks to Kanta, whose obsidian gaze acknowledges him.

"One million credits," says Cydonia with an unusual affect, then adds "Dull, very dull. But a queenly sum nonetheless."

options: kpLobster:A thousand crates of Volturnian Lobster

text:
"A thousand crates of Andrada's best, how..." the doctor pauses, quickly glancing to the black eyes of Kanta for confirmation. 

"...delightful," Cydonia concludes as if he was going to say it all along. "It will bring pleasure to our warlord-queen to vex Andrada's customs ministry with the mystery of how so many of his cold-blooded spawn slithered from his grasp."

For her part, Kanta nods, apparently satisfied, though it is impossible to know through her mask of a face.

"Oh, oh, th-" Cydonia almost bounces with excitement, but his mewling is crushed by Kanta's synthesized voice.

"A weapon of transcendent power," she booms. "A beautiful thing. THIS. Is a gift worthy of Kanta." Her dark eyes scan the crowds accusingly, demanding someone match this prize. None can.

options: kpHamatsu:The ISS Hamatsu, a ship of great sentimental value to Callisto Ibrahim

text:
"This, this bucket of bolts is unfit for the lowest scavenger following in a pirate's wake," Cydonia starts working himself into a lather. "-Let alone a Queen!"

Kanta stands with a clank and the doctor drops into a confused silence. Kanta's synthesized voice bursts like a roar: "Your cruelty is subtle, and impressive. It will please us to take Ibrahim's most treasured ship. We shall have it overhauled and used to plunder the weak. Each prize, each victory taken will wound her."

The artificial words drip with pleasure; it is an intimate view into Kanta's psyche, and her court shuffles uncomfortably. Cydonia stutters as he makes arrangements, clearly displeased.

options: kpZiggurat:A Ziggurat-class starship, the only one of its kind

text:
"Ah, ah ah," Cydonia's throat makes an uncomfortable noise. "A truly unique specimen, a fitting trophy from Tri-Tachyon! Beautiful, my queen-"

"NO." Kanta's denial overwhelms Cydonia's mewling praise. "That," she booms, "Is a fool's prize. Desired beyond all reason by the factions, and others; it invites disaster from this world and those unknown."

She sits with finality, and her last words echo in the court-chamber, which has gone oddly quiet but for a wash of fearful susurration. Kanta is not much known for natural philosophy; her courtiers speculate at her implication.

"That? So garish, so useless," Cydonia sputters, "And expensive. It would require an AI-core and special technicians to keep working at all. Think of the expense, and-"

Kanta's voice rolls over Cydonia's whining like thunder: "Glorious!"

"It shall be a monument to Tri-Tachyon's betrayal," she booms, "And to Hegemony weakness. We shall display it proudly, and invite them to remove their shame. They will cringe in fear!"
notes: # A big, useless trophy, since they require the Automated Ships skill. Change Kanta's Den description to mention it being displayed prominently.

text: A Remnant capital ship, your gift to the pirate queen, has been hollowed of its valuable parts and crudely affixed to the exterior of Kanta's Den like a garish hunting trophy.

The core of the drone replicator is dragged into the court on an agrav sled and the specs read aloud at Cydonia's instructions by some kind of lead technician.

Certain phrases stand out: "autonomous hunter-killer", "exploding-tip fragmentation", "semi-lethal crowd-control escalation",  "adjustable potency chemical irritant", "30,000 rounds-per-minute", "excruciating burning sensation".

Kanta nods along, seemingly enthralled. Cydonia glances between you and her, ensuring that he is following the lead of his queen.

As the reading is finished, Cydonia exchanges one last look with Kanta then turns approvingly to the technician. "Take it to The Arena!" he shouts, and Kanta's court erupts with thunderous shouts and stomps.

options: kpDealmaker:A Domain-era Dealmaker Holosuite, adaptable for medical experiments

text:
Kanta blasts her synthetic approval, "YES. A delightful toy for my Cydonia, for his little experiments, his playthings. Won't they amuse us?" With a creak of metal and clatter of beads and trophies, Kanta turns to look upon Cydonia. 
 
He seems to shrink, "Y- yes, my queen. I'm sure- I suppose it could be... repurposed for my needs. There will be less need for live... subjects, I suppose."

The 'doctor' looks crestfallen at this development. It would seem that Kanta doesn't notice, or care.

"That?" Cydonia's face contorts into a seemingly impossible sneer. "You can find junk like that in half the ruins in the fringe systems alone! It's a lump of technological excrement passed by the dying idiot-corpse of the Domain!" 

Kanta looks on, impassive. Bored, almost, if her moods could be divined by the subtle shift and hum of her augments.

Cydonia looks uncertain, glances at Kanta, then back to you. His mouth opens, and you hear a grinding, throbbing sound. It builds, louder. Laughter.

Kanta stands, laughing. Then stops; black eyes fixed on you. Cydonia and the court are frozen silent, awaiting her mercurial judgment.

"It is a beautiful thing you offer," she booms at you in synth-voice. "But a predator's weapon is not terracide. Keep it. And be pursued by small men dreaming dreams of death to the end of the Arm of Perseus."

Cydonia, and the court, bow at her judgment; murmuring.

options: kpPristineForge:A pristine Domain-era Nanoforge, a true rarity

text:
"I... I, yes, yes" Cydonia caresses the specifications you transmitted to his datapad. He capers around the grim totems surrounding Kanta's throne and excitedly shows her the screen. Her attention is, for a moment, laser-focused. Her court of pirates murmur and whisper.

Finally, Kanta's gauntleted hand, strength enhanced by cybernetics, shoves Cydonia away like a dewy-eyed lapdog. He nearly topples from the platform, but manages to recover his balance.

Kanta stands with a clank, the hum of her synthetic voice grows, a raw buzz, in anticipation of her proclamation.

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL pristine_nanoforge -1
$player.gavePristineNanoforgeToKanta = true
KantaCMD gavePristineNanoforge 60
text:
"A worthy gift," her voice blasts. "The heart of Domain power - torn from the chest of the dead colossus, it will beat now for ME." Her words echo painfully off the metal panels of the chamber. 

"Great teeth it shall grow! Again will the Persean Sector learn true fear of the WARLORD."

The court erupts in cheers, and a chaos of stomping boots and pounding longarms resolves into a chant. "KAN-TA, KAN-TA". She revels in their praise, and their bloodlust.

Long-abandoned factory rings thrum with activity and glimmer with new construction. Fresh ship hulls are assembled, sharp ribs laid with armored plates and fit with weapons of war. Kanta has installed a pristine nanoforge here, and her family is making use of it.

"What," Cydonia's lip curls into a sneer, "would the mighty warlord do with-" 

There's a heavy clank, all turn to find that Kanta is standing, trailing trophies and tubes. "WE ACCEPT," her vocoder blasts, the voice inhuman. "Vacuum AND fire shall greet those prisoners I wish to dispose."

The pirates of the court cheer to this, stomping their feet and slamming weapon-stocks into the deck plates.

TODO I wonder if it's possible / would look decent to have it show the visual around Kanta's Den. Would need to look into it. Augh - oddly enough, a *Planetary* Shield does require a planet to work; no-go on the station. -am

Cydonia inspects the blueprint specifications on his datapad, pallid fingers caressing the display. "Hmm, mmm, yes."

He capers up Kanta's throne, dodging the twisted remains of hand weapons and morbid totems, to show the pirate queen your offering.

Kanta's cybernetic mask of a face does turn to look, and in but a moment her gauntleted arm whirrs and shoves Cydonia away like an annoying pet.

She stands with the thrum of servos, sending Cydonia tumbling off the platform. Miraculously, he is not impaled on any of the jagged prizes which festoon the base of Kanta's throne.

"WE ACCEPT," she booms in a voice like a synthesized orbital strike, and raises a gauntleted fist.

"Install this in our arsenal. A new blade for our hunters, the Sector shall bleed rich and deep!"

The pirate court cheers, pounding the deckplates with boots and weapons.

options: kpContact:Compromising information on $foundContactName, $foundContactFaction $foundContactPost and trusted contact

text:
Cydonia rolls his eyes theatrically as you declare your willingness to betray a contact at Kanta's will. "A worthless-" he begins.

A rhythmic thudding overpowers him, like the sound of a malfunctioning shield capacitor locked into a destructive charge cycle. You suppress your instinctual reaction to that danger as you realize that Kanta is laughing. Cydonia cringes, holding pallid hands over his ears.

With a dying echo, her laughter stops.

She speaks with the voice of a mechanical demon, "A willing betrayer; most delectable. You understand that the softest weapon may cause the most pain."

Her cyberauged body draws a deep, ragged breath, and she continues, "The anticipation shall bring us such pleasure."

script: SetStoryOption kpGiftFavor general "Offered Kanta a favor of her choosing in exchange for her protection"
options: 1000:kpGiftFavor:A favor of her choosing, at any time in the future

text:
Cydonia frowns petulantly through your declaration.

"A favor?" he calls out shrilly, "My mighty queen's protection for the feeble promise of a-"

A metallic boom and the electric hum of overcharged amplification drown out Cydonia's mockery. Kanta's voice is like thunder, echoing off the armored wall-panels of the court chamber. 

"WE ACCEPT."

With those simple words, she sits. Her face, a dark mask, has no expression you can discern. But she might be smiling to herself, somewhere inside her shell.

options: 1001:kpLeave:"I shall take my leave to consider what sort of gift befits the pirate queen."

text:
You step back from the center of the court-chamber, your time in the garish spotlight now finished.

Kanta's metal body hisses on her throne, patient as a landmine. Cydonia scuttles to speak with one or another pirate sergeant responsible for prisoners and petitioners awaiting Kanta's judgment.

script:
unset $market.kpAudience
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
As you leave, the court rumbles, and calls, jeers and admonitions directed at you, and each other.

Pirates in the corridors of Kanta's Den glower and grumble at your passing, their eyes promising secret blood spilled at some future opportunity.

You step back from the center of the court-chamber. Kanta's metal body hisses on her throne, patient as a landmine. Cydonia scuttles to speak with one or another pirate sergeant responsible for prisoners and petitioners awaiting Kanta's judgment.

The pirates shout and cheer, their wild stylings and radical augmentations giving Kanta's Court the aspect of Pandemonium.

script:
unset $market.kpAudience
$player.kantaProtection = true
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
FireAll PopulateOptions
text: As you leave, pirates call and grab at your hands and slap your back, winking and greeting you as ersatz-sibling, now. Others glower and grumble, their eyes promising secret blood spilled at some future opportunity.

id: # A favor for Kanta - courier finds you

conditions:
!KantaCMD alreadyDidFavor
!$global.affk_inProgress
BeginMission affk false
Call $global.affk_ref updateData
text:
The comm-link flickers as it establishes the connection. Error codes flash by - outdated protocols and unauthorized modifications.

The pirate $rank appears, arms crossed. "Captain $playerName. I bring you greetings from the Warlord Kanta, mighty and ruthless. She has been watching your career and is pleased that you are prospering under her protection agreement."

This must be about the agreement you made, to do Kanta a 'favor' in exchange for her protection.
options:
affkContinue:Continue
affkContinueWant:"What does Kanta want?"
affkContinueSarcastic:"So that's it? Tell her 'thanks'."

text:
当你的通讯器与海盗用的鬼玩意完成握手时，通讯链路闪烁，卡死，并重新启动。

海盗 $rank 出现在画面上，$HeOrShe已经露出了得意的表情。" $playerName 舰长。我在这里代表 Kanta 的无情。她希望你明白她有许多双眼睛在注视着你。"

$HeOrShe微笑着，露出被锉尖的牙齿。"我要说的就是这些。"
The pirate produces a thin, mocking smile which displays $hisOrHer sharpened teeth, and says "No, that's not 'it', captain."
The pirate produces a thin, mocking smile which displays $hisOrHer sharpened teeth.

"The Warlord Kanta wishes for you to perform a tactical bombardment," $heOrShe glances at a battered datapad, "on the military base of $affk_marketName. This shall demonstrate that none who cross Kanta may escape her reach!"
options:
affkAcceptA:"Fine. I'll do it." (accept)
affkAcceptB:"It is my pleasure to fulfill the Warlord's wishes." (accept)
affkDeclineA:"No, there has to be some alternative." (decline)
affkDeclineB:"Are you mad? Bombard $affk_marketName? It's suicide." (decline)

text:
The pirate puts on a look of concern, probably false. "This is not a negotiation, captain. The Warlord demands blood and ruin, so it you will provide."

"It comes either from $affk_marketName, or from you," $heOrShe casually drops $hisOrHer datapad. "The choice is yours."

The pirate looks amused. "There is not," $heOrShe shrugs with feigned calm. 

"What Kanta demands, Kanta gets. Our choice is whether to stand in the way of her rage - to what, prove something? It proves nothing. This is the way of the Persean Sector, captain."

"So," $heOrShe taps a short rhythm on $hisOrHer control console. "If it is suicide you think will result, then Kanta can provide your death just as well as some faction-navy. Choose."

options:
affkAccept:Accept the mission after all
affkDecline2:Assert that you decline Kanta's demand

text:
"More's the pity," the pirate says coldly, drawing the line of a tear down $hisOrHer face.

The comms cut to a distorted skull overlaid on scenes of ultraviolence; a common affectation of dedicated, professional pirates.
"Of course you will," $heOrShe says, "For when Kanta demands blood, she will have blood. One way or another."
"I am certain," $heOrShe says, "That Kanta will herself be most pleased by the blood and ruin you create for her."

Kanta's minion transfers you the relevant data to perform the operation: a cursory nav entry providing no useful tactical info, a quick skim tells you. Your approach is all up to you. It would definitely be prudent to launch the attack with your transponder off, for starters...

$HeOrShe bares $hisOrHer protruding diamond canines - a hot look among certain crowds, you're sure. "Remember to have fun," $heOrShe says, then cuts the link.

script:
MakeOtherFleetImportant kantaFavorCourier false
unset $entity.genericHail
KantaCMD abortFavor
text:
The comm-link flickers as it establishes the connection. Some error codes flash by, something about outdated protocols and unauthorized modifications.

The pirate $rank appears, arms crossed. "Captain $playerName. I bring you greetings from the Warlord Kanta. She has been watching your career and is pleased that you are prospering under her protection agreement."
options:
affkFailContinueWant:"What does Kanta want?"
affkFailContinueSarcastic:"So that's it? Tell her 'thanks'."

text:
"Nothing," $heOrShe says. "Yet." 

The pirate flashes a sharp-toothed smile, diamond canines flashing, then hits the comms cutoff.

"Yes," $heOrShe says, unamused at your flippant remark, "You should be thankful. You have been spared the Warlord Kanta's thirst for blood and ruin. For now." 

$HeOrShe leans in, "When that thirst awakens, you will provide her with what she demands." The pirate flashes a sharp-toothed smile, diamond canines flashing, "One way, or another."

$HeOrShe hits the comms cutoff.

$marketName fills your bridge tactical display, a spatter of hollowed icons representing dead targets. The last one blinks out. This should make the Warlord Kanta happy, if she is even capable of that emotion anymore.

You wave a hand to collapse the tactical display, and it winks out obediently. The holomatrix snows then reforms a navigational overview, your $shipOrFleet holding station in the center.

id: # talking to pirate station king, making a deal re: hostile pirate activity at your colonies

text:
The comms flicker and spit, resolving into the grinning image of $post.

"Well, well, well," $heOrShe drawls. "An independent proprietor has come to my humble outpost. Whatever for?" $HeOrShe puts on a perplexed look, "I've heard that it's dangerous out here."
options:
psk_discussBusiness:"We have 'business' to discuss."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
The comms flicker and spit, resolving into the frowning image of $post.

"The prey crawls before me," $heOrShe says, glaring. "Why should we believe what it has to say?"
options:
psk_discussBusiness:"We have business to discuss."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

script: SetStoryOption psk_discussBusinessStory 1 makeDealWithPirateBase ui_char_spent_story_point "Talked your way into a protection agreement with a pirate base commander"
text:
The comms flicker and spit, resolving into the scowling image of $post.

"Look at you, prey. Writhing and lying and tricking to escape from our trap."

"We'll bleed you dry," $heOrShe hisses.
options:
psk_discussBusinessStory:"I wish to discuss business."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

script:
Highlight "10% of the gross income"
FireAll PirateStationKingBizOptions
text:
"So we do, so we do. It is pleasing that you've decided to be civilized about it," the pirate puts on a self-satisfied smile.

"The fringe is dangerous!" $heOrShe explains, "And my people hungry. I propose that you provide me with 10% of the gross income of your colony. I shall see that my compatriots, ah, protect your trade lanes and reign in the desperate scavengers who might feel enticed to raid for much-needed supplies."

script: Highlight "10% of the gross income" FireAll PirateStationKingBizOptions
text:
"So we do, so we do." The pirate does not smile. "And yet. You say 'business', but I'm no fool - I've heard of your treachery. Call me a pirate, but I rob and kill honestly."

$HeOrShe continues without considering $himOrHerself to have made any kind of contradiction, "I am also known for my forgiving moods. So I shall offer you a chance to repair your reputation: give me 10% of the gross income from your colony. My compatriots will protect your trade lanes and reign in the desperate scavengers who might feel enticed to raid for much-needed supplies."

$HeOrShe puts on a conciliatory grin.

script:
Highlight "10% of the gross income"
FireAll PirateStationKingBizOptions
SetStoryOption psk_acceptStory 1 makeDealWithPirateBase ui_char_spent_story_point "Talked your way into a protection agreement with a pirate base commander"
text:
"Business? You're a liar, captain. I'd respect if you shot me in the back, but only if you did it honestly. This?" $HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head in disgust, apparently, at your duplicity.

"I'll not be your next fool. The only business there is to do between us will be done through ships of war."
options:
psk_acceptStory:"You'll have 10% of the gross income of my colonies and I'll tell you why you'll accept."
psk_decline:"Never mind."
psk_businessTooMuchReasonable:"10 percent is too much. Be reasonable."
psk_businessTooMuchFleet:"An outrageous demand! You can see the power of my $shipOrFleet from where you sit."

script:
SetEnabled psk_businessTooMuchFleet false
SetTooltip psk_businessTooMuchFleet "Requires a non-civilian capital ship in your fleet."

text:
"I'm afraid my compatriots will accept no less. In my position, I must... provide. A king who does not provide..." 

A note of legitimate worry seems to have entered $hisOrHer voice. $HeOrShe tries to cover it by re-asserting a smug smile, but it is half-hearted at best.

"Come now; as the king of a gang yourself - whatever you want to call it - you understand. We are all shackled in a great chain from high to low and low to high. The weak must pledge what strength they have to the powerful so that they are not crushed."
options:
psk_businessTooMuchReasonableA:"You justify piracy with that nonsense?"
psk_businessTooMuchReasonableB:"So you're calling me weak."
psk_businessTooMuchReasonableC:"So you're calling me powerful."

text: $HeOrShe shrugs, smile wavering.

"I, um." $HeOrShe realizes that $heOrShe has walked into a trap of $hisOrHer own making - and coughs, lamely.

"And possibly even among possible equals, each must contribute what they are best able, don't you agree? A few credits for protection, it's a fair trade."

"And an admirable fleet it is," $heOrShe admits, giving a moment of dainty applause. "But greater empires than yours have sent fleets to sweep away the rubbish, yes?"

$HeOrShe leans closer to the comm-interface, smile gone. "Believe me, captain, I have no desire for this to come to a fight. My crews... they have expectations. If I do not meet them, they will toss me out the airlock and find someone who will."

$HeOrShe sits back. "Heavy is the crown," $heOrShe mutters grimly.

The pirate snorts and crosses $hisOrHer arms. "Listening."

You pull up the report prepared by your quartermaster and begin reading the executive summary, taking care to enunciate the large numbers describing the credits moving through your properties.

It takes little to inflame the pirate's greed. You pause dramatically and look over your TriPad; $personName licks $hisOrHer lips and says "You have yourself a deal."
$HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head as if sad, "I tried, didn't I. It'd be such a shame if something happened to your lovely little colony."

The pirate pulls a bottle of something from behind $hisOrHer comms console, and lifts it up.

"To our mutual betterment!" $heOrShe declares, then takes a long glug. $HeOrShe slams the bottle on the console, and wipes $hisOrHer mouth with $hisOrHer sleeve, not quite suppressing a belch.

And with that it seems that your 'arrangement' is sealed.

id: # talking to the pirate base commander to cancel the deal

text:
"Oh!" $HeOrShe actually jumps a bit with the shock of your pronouncement, but quickly tries to play it cool. "More's the pity. This'll be a black mark on my otherwise perfect day. But," $heOrShe shrugs, "I get it. Gotta look out for number one. If you don't, you look like easy prey."

$HeOrShe thumps $hisOrHer chest, almost managing to hide the tremble in $hisOrHer hands. "Point made, message received. Now, will you reconsider?"
options:
psk_cancelDealConfirm:"It's over. Don't make me repeat myself."
psk_cancelDealNeverMind:"Okay, let's keep the protection deal."

text:
"Wisely done, captain." $HeOrShe tries to conceal $hisOrHer relief. "Why fight when our arrangement means we can each spend more time enjoying the better things in life?"

$HeOrShe flicks a grubby bottle of something stashed beside the comms console, making a distinct 'ting' sound.

$HeOrShe goes still. "I, I think we understand one another, $playerName."

"My raiders will be hunting you. Don't bore them, now." The $post makes a toothy and joyless grimace.

id: # talking to mercenary that's going to attack the pirate base you have an agreement with

text:
"Comms open to captain of independent $shipOrFleet." The mercenary $rank looks you over in a cold assessment. 

"Be advised: stay clear of our operational volume. We are in the process of fulfilling a private contract to destroy the nearby pirate station."

"You may now go," the merc flicks a hand dismissively. "We shall see to the safety of this and nearby systems."

options: pskMerc_attack:切断通讯链接并将武器充能
pskMerc_threaten:"That station is my concern only. It is you who shall leave. Now."

script: SetStoryOption pskMerc_story ui_char_spent_story_point "Talked a bounty hunter out of attacking a pirate base you had an agreement with"
options: pskMerc_story:"That may not be a good idea." (talk them out of it)

text: "Indeed," $heOrShe says. "When necessity calls for force, matters are best left to an expert - such as myself."

script:
MakeOtherFleetHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetAggressive psk true
$option = cutCommLinkNoText 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text: You dispense with the pleasantries.

script:
AdjustRep $faction.id -5
AdjustRepActivePerson -10
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
text:
"I see," $heOrShe says, scrolling through a display, doing some mental calculation. "I see very well that you shall appeal to brute force of numbers to dissuade me from my contract."

"A crude bargaining tactic, but," $heOrShe slaps away a datapad, presumably containing $hisOrHer tactical officer's report. "Effective nonetheless. Good day, $playerSirOrMadam. I will be sure to keep you in my thoughts."

"I will do you the favor of interpreting your words as a joke," $heOrShe says. "And not a very good one."

"I'll waste no more time with you." $HeOrShe nods to someone and the link freezes, the data stream cut without even a termination code.
"Oh? Do tell." $HeOrShe looks both offended and just a little bit intrigued. As if $heOrShe wants to see what pathetic excuse you come up with so that $heOrShe may reject it.

You explain that this particular group of pirates has had their threat deliberately under-rated by a conspiracy of mercenary companies. Black Quiver, Ilm's Orphans, SNC, Tactistar; they're all in on it, including the pirates.

Mercenary contracts aren't paying what they used to, you explain, as of course $heOrShe probably knows. They think they can get top-quality work - you indicate $personName's fleet - for prices that barely turn a profit once the fuel, supplies, and crew wages are paid out post-operation. You see $himOrHer nodding along.

The problem is that all the competition is driving prices down - and this cartel of mercs decided to cut a deal with some pirates to solve the problem.

It's the perfect trap, really: a stream of under-prepared prey gets fed to the pirates, enhancing their reputation. The supply of mercs taking low-ball contracts is reduced, driving up the prices of the old guard cartel. And, best of all, it's deniable: if the pirates are destroyed, so are the cartel's partners in their conspiracy.
options: pskMerc_story3:"I'm not saying you're under-prepared. Quite the opposite..."

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRepActivePerson 5
text:
"Bring only enough materiel to complete the job," $heOrShe finishes for you. "Otherwise you're burning net profit to bring extra warships not needed for the fight. Yes, I'm a professional and have done the calculations."

The merc pauses for a moment, thinking over what you've said.

"Very clever," $heOrShe says, seeming to regard you more as a comrade now than an interloper. "Naturally this cartel will deny it if confronted. Almost wish I'd thought of the scheme myself," a ruthless grin appears, "But I'll settle for the higher rates resulting from their cull of the herd."

"Thanks for the tip, captain. There's another job on the docket that I liked better anyway."

script:
SetOptionColor pk_recoverMissionDev gray
SetOptionColor pk_recoverMissionDev2 gray
options:
100:pk_recoverMissionDev:Start the PK mission
101:pk_recoverMissionDev2:Start the PK conversation
pkPather_recoverMission:"我要你的人停止在我的工业设施上搞破坏。"
pkPather_recoverMission:"我不是你的敌人，为什么你们要袭击我的人？"
pkPather_recoverMission:"我将卢德的福音传遍四海，尽管不是用你们的方式，你们为什么还要袭击我的人民？"
pkPather_recoverMission:"你们袭击了我的人民，尽管我为卢德教会服务。除了我，难道就没有对你们威胁更大的敌人了吗？"

text:
$HeOrShe听了你的话，沉思片刻。

"我们之间的误解太深了。" $heOrShe说。"你明知我们目标明确，决心坚定。我们知道，疯狂驱使着你为恶魔摩洛克建造更大的圣地。唉，但凡我们的祈祷得到过回应！但凡你的心没有对卢德的话充耳不闻！"

"在绝望中，我们诉诸圣战。但也许你我能探索到别的出路 —— 尽管你对我们撒谎在先，我还是没有放弃和解的选择。"
options:
pkPath_recoverMission1:"既然如此，看来你愿意和我做个交易。"
pkPather_recoverMissionTerrorists:"我不与恐怖分子谈判。"
cutCommLink:"不，我受够你了。" (切断通讯链接)

text: "我们也不与玷污造物主的恶徒相处，" $heOrShe平静地说。"但你知道，事实并非总是如此。"

$hisOrHer嘴唇上掠过一丝笑意。"我们了解彼此。"

"我们想要的东西微不足道；不是星币，不是战舰。然而，" $heOrShe从容不迫地停顿了一下。"是一样别的东西。"

"这会说服我，和我组织中其他志同道合的人，把净化你的工业放在一边... 当然，直到世界末日，我们的军队将在最终决战中与你相遇。但在那荣耀之日到来之前，你可以尽情享受你那些小饰品和神像。"
options: pkPath_recoverMission2:"直说吧，你到底想要什么？"

text: $HeOrShe点了点头， "一颗歼星武器。"

"你的表情已经说明你对这些可憎事物的了解；人之领 那残害了Opis及其数十亿居民的不洁造物；它还毁掉了 Hanan Pacha，和其他数不胜数的世界。"

"我知道哪里能找到一枚。把它带给我，然后我们之间的圣战就会永远结束。" $HeOrShe略微低下了头，"直到世界末日。"

options: pkPather_askEndOfWorld:"你口中的 '世界末日' 是什么意思？"
pkPather_askWhatDo:"你要用行星杀手做什么？那不是罪恶的吗？"
pkPather_askWhyYouNot:"如果你知道它在哪，那你为什么不自己去取？"
pkPather_askHowInfo:"你怎么知道的？你的消息准确吗？"
pkPather_sayThink:"我需要时间来考虑这件事。"
pkPather_sayNo:"决不！把行星杀手送给左径信徒，这种行为已经不能用鲁莽来形容了。"
pkPather_where:"嗯，一颗用来维持和平的行星杀手。我需要去哪？"

text: "那正如卢德的预言，" $heOrShe说。"很多迹象已经被预言到了。有些迹象，但不是全部，已经成为现实了。"
"这对你来说小事一桩，舰长。作为异教徒，你缺少对世界末日应有的恐惧和光荣的期待。"

"我们并不打算透露自己的战略。"

左径分子当然不会说。

他们可能会让你参与自卢德左径毁灭 Mairaath 世界后最严重的暴行。他们会在哪里使用行星杀手？Chicomoztoc? Culann? Kazeron?

这会夺走上百万人的生命，同时一个主要势力的战略支柱将化为灰烬。

"有些人试过了" $HeOrShe停顿了一下，眼睛失去了光泽。"他们没能返航。"

无论它在哪里，这次行动一定非常危险，或者不知为何超出了卢德左径的技术水平。

所以它可能被严密看管。

$HisOrHer嘴唇诡异地抽动着，好像被你的话逗笑了，"英仙座星域充满了恶魔玛门的奴隶。他们甚至会为了金钱卖掉自己的家人。他们哪里知道，这条指向行星杀手的冰冷线索，正隐藏在自己所信奉的 AI 秽物的尖牙利爪之下？"

"这只是很容易就能买到的小道消息罢了。"

"如果你找到了真理，就好好想想然后回来吧。" $heOrShe说，并用手指在通讯控制台上敲了几下。

"在那之前，也许一个更勇敢，更贪婪的异教徒会接受我的提议。也许不会。"
$HeOrShe没有任何惊讶地点了点头。"那么圣战将会继续。"

conditions:
$option == pkPather_where
BeginMission pk false
Call $global.pk_ref updateData
text:
左径分子在数据平板上点了几下，打开了一个共享数据库。"有一个令人憎恶的巢穴，你可以称其为余晖中枢，其中有关于一支 霸主 舰队的数据 —— 那支舰队曾携带过一颗行星杀手。它在 $pk_nexusSystemName 星系里。" 

$HeOrShe她举起一只手，期待着你的提问。"我们已经确认这条来自 速子科技 的消息的真实性。这些详细信息和 霸主 关于战略数据泄露的记录，以及一支在第一次 AI 战争中失踪舰队的信息完全符合。"

"别看起来这么吃惊，舰长，" $heOrShe略带责备地说。"对卢德福音的信仰与在专用名词方面的知识并不矛盾。"
options:
pkPather_sayYes:"我会找到 行星杀手 并带给你。"
pkPather_sayYesLie:"我会为你抓住这只鸟。"（说谎）
pk_recoverMissionAbort:"实际上，我改变主意了。"

text:
那个左径分子在一个老旧的数据平板上敲了几下，然后停了下来，并仔细打量着你。

"我的意志有些犹豫不决。为什么？" $HeOrShe缓缓地放下了数据平板。"你，恶魔摩洛克的奴隶，怎能如此平和地与我交谈？这一定是一个诡计，你是为了你某些不可告人的目的而透露给我们这些信息？还是为了速子科技？霸主？"

你可以看到$HeOrShe的表情从不信任转为了厌恶。"我不会上你的当的，你这蠢货，你意图寻找亵渎者的工具！" $HeOrShe站起来，喝道："从这里滚出去！"
只要左径教徒们不把行星杀手用在你身上，那就不关你的事。也许他们会把它扔进一个黑洞里，谁知道呢？
如果真的把行星杀手交给左径教徒，那就太疯狂了。但如果线索是真的，你可以把它收入你手中 - 然后自己决定怎么处理它。
"I shall pray for your safe return," $heOrShe says without irony.

script:
$player.knowsPatherLeadOnPKButNoCommit = true
AdjustRepActivePerson INHOSPITABLE -2
Call $global.pk_ref hideNexusSystem
AbortMission
text:
$PersonName's eyes narrow, fully aware that you now know their lead on the planetkiller and have no stated intent to fulfill the proposed deal.

"I shall pray for you," $heOrShe says without apparent irony.

id: # PK in-mission interactions, also mid-mission start by destroying the nexus

text:
"$PlayerSirOrMadam!" 

Your comms officer calls for your attention with an excited look, "I'm picking up an anomalous signal, it's an open channel. Just a carrier signal, a low-grade military fallback standard. Very faint and lossy. We're really only picking this up because of the MILAUX package installed in our comms system to help integrate with Hegemony fleet actions."

"Shall I open a link?" Their hands don't quite tremble over the controls. Whatever is using this frequency is either Hegemony or has some of their less secure emergency codes.
options:
pk_investigate:尝试在此频道建立通讯链接
pk_ignore:忽视它并靠近小行星

text:
Your comms officer tags the faint carrier wave which is using an obscure Hegemony signal standard. Someone - or perhaps no one - has been waiting for a response for quite some time.
 
"Shall I open a link?" your comms officer asks, mostly keeping their excitement over a mystery signal under control. Mostly.
options:
pk_investigate:尝试在此频道建立通讯链接
pk_ignore:忽视它并靠近小行星

text:
Comms opens the link. Your sensors and tactical officers start flickering interfaces on their control consoles, and they exchange a look.

Tactical begins with a report, "SIGINT matches... almost... with previous encounters with autonomous Domain warships."

"I think," your comms officer jumps in, "I think I can convince their governing routines to stand-down from aggressive guard mode. We've got part of a very old Domain codeset in the Hegemony MILAUX package, meant to help auxiliaries avoid getting blasted by auto-defenses. We can't order a complete stand-down though; they didn't give us everything."
options:
pk_proceed:"Try the codes. Maybe we can avoid a fight."
pk_almost:"Tactical, what do you mean 'almost'?"
pk_ignore:Close the link and close in on the asteroid

text:
"It's strange, $playerSirOrMadam," your tactical officer says, eyes flicking between displays. "They're using protocols newer than Domain-era, but certainly not recent Hegemony. It looks like something out of... the First AI War, I'd say."

Which could suggest something dangerous, and potentially more sophisticated than the current standard of Persean Sector military technology.

Your comms officer gives a sanguine "Aye $playerSirOrMadam!" and starts transmitting. Your tactical officer turns to their station with a grim look.

You're not held long in suspense, for a fraction of a second after transmission an acknowledgment ping flashes on your comms officer's console. The asteroid blooms, casting undetected bogeys from itself in glowing icons on the tactical display. The bogeys form up into a standard patrol formation with inhuman synchronization.

It would have been a spectacular ambush to walk into.

Hull-ids come in; combat-scarred XIV Battlegroup hulls, repaired without orbital dockyards. A veteran fleet, for sure. Between the fact that they've been hidden here for many cycles and your SIGINT, it is clear that humans do not command these ships.

But now the way is clear. Tactical mutters to sensors about keeping an eye on the automated swarm.
options: pk_salvage:Send a salvor team to access the cache

text:
Your ops chief oversees the operation with familiar gruffness and wariness.

The salvors use a cloud of microdrones to cast a sensor net over the asteroid, coordinating with your $shipOrFleet's technicians to map density anomalies. There are faster methods, but this is the best way to find the surprises that tend to be left to protect far-flung caches.

The rock is spotted with hiding holes, empty, and fuel and supply stores, also empty. No surprise fusion mines or pinhead AM traps. Ops finally gives the order, and the salvors move in to uncover the camouflaged access point.

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller 1
$global.pk_completed = true 0
$global.pk_recovered = true
Call $global.pk_ref updateStage
DespawnEntity
text:
The shaky image from a salvor's helmetcam reveals the carapace of terrestrial death, glittering in the chaotic play of suitlamps.

One planetkiller.

Your ops chief cuts the excited chatter between salvors with a harsh word, and they return to procedural call-and-response. The planetkiller is soon secured in your flagship.

Your $shipOrFleet maneuvers closer to the asteroid.

Your sensors officer gives a shout of alarm - bogeys are spilling out of the asteroid, clouds of loosely-piled regolith and stealth-sheath panels spinning away as they are caught by thruster-bursts. The angular forms of Domain XIV Battlegroup hulls appear, veteran ships judging by the obvious field repairs. The IDs are automatically tagged and collated into the tactical display.

You have no time to ask why a ghost fleet from the First AI War has ambushed you.

Data recovery from a Tri-Tachyon war-AI nexus is laborious due to the unusual hardware and the AI-designed data architecture which seems to delight in confounding idiosyncrasies. 

"I've heard speculation that it's like art to them," your tech officer says, noticing your attention. "To the AIs, I mean. Like poetry expressed through mathematics."

You know what to look for, however, which makes the often unprofitably onerous data analysis yield results more quickly.

Data recovery from a Tri-Tachyon war-AI nexus is laborious due to the unusual hardware and the AI-designed data architecture which seems to delight in confounding idiosyncrasies. 

"I've heard speculation that it's like art to them," your tech officer says, noticing your attention. "To the AIs, I mean. Like poetry expressed through mathematics."

Some hours later, you receive an excited summons from your tech officer.

"$PlayerSirOrMadam。我当时正在做标准分析，搜集情报、密钥、过去的速子科技文件，呃，" 他们几乎是结巴着说出这句话的。

"一条记录显示，一支从这个中枢出发的余晖分队遭遇了 霸主 舰队。它们在数分钟内被击溃 —— 那一定是一场惨败。速子科技 在第一次 AI 战争中制定的协议允许他们使用 AI 管理数据存储。这些 AI 为规划者提供报告，尽管他们只是把那些东西用来训练更多的 AI 并且，呃，这里有一台行星杀手装置。" 

你的技术专家对你瞪大了眼睛。 "那种武器。一台行星杀手。" 他们像发现了尸体的孩子一样不断表现出病态的兴奋， "霸主舰队把它藏在了一颗遥远偏僻的小行星里。"

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller 1
$global.pk_completed = true 0
$global.pk_recovered = true
Call $global.pk_ref updateStage
DespawnEntity
text:
那支全自动舰队所保护的小行星上布满了空荡荡的隐藏洞穴，里面的燃料和补给库空空如也。在彻底的传感器扫描后，你的行动长官终于下达了命令，让打捞队进入了其中一个隐藏洞口。

头戴式摄像机传回了地壳崩坏瓦解的图像，在便携灯的照射下闪闪发光。

一台行星杀手。

你的行动长官一声令下，打断了打捞队员们兴奋的七嘴八舌，他们又开始一如既往地做出回复。行星杀手很快就被送到了你的旗舰上。

一颗遗失已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域每个人头顶上的不祥阴影。它那残暴肆虐力量，是曾让 Opis、Hanan Pacha 以及其他世界覆灭的罪魁祸首。

许多强大的势力都希望能拥有这样一件武器，来确保他们不会因为一次闪电突袭就被踢下王座。而许多二流势力也希望用其确保自己能受到尊重和保护。至于左径信徒会拿这件装置干些什么，恐怕只有卢德他老人家才会知道，而海盗们就更别提了。

一颗失落已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域所有人类头顶上的不祥阴影；在被它蹂躏过的其它所有世界上，包括 Opis，Hanan Pacha 在内，都留下了刻骨铭心的伤痛。

只有卢德他老人家才知道左径信徒会打算用这样的装置干些什么，而当你敲定这笔交易时，可没有蠢到简简单单地把行星杀手交出去只为了看看这样做会带来何种后果。

无论你作出何种努力，他们都会很快知道你发现了些什么。消息会通过他们的监视网络不胫而走，无论是来自你船员中的线人，亦或者是祈祷与臆测。

一颗失落已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域所有人类头顶上的不祥阴影；在被它蹂躏过的其它所有世界上，包括 Opis，Hanan Pacha 在内，都留下了刻骨铭心的伤痛。

只有卢德他老人家才知道左径信徒会打算用这样的装置干些什么。然而你已经同意把行星杀手交给他们，也许他们只是想保障自己在这片星域里的安全和立足之地 —— 也许他们只是想毁掉这台可怕的憎恶科技造物。

无论你作出何种努力，他们都会很快知道你发现了些什么。消息会通过他们的监视网络不胫而走，无论是来自你船员中的线人，亦或者是祈祷与臆测。

id: # recover PK - comm relay hack interaction

options: 0:pk_hackMenu:尝试远程黑入中枢，取回行星杀手的位置信息。

script:
SetStoryOption pk_hackStory technology "使用附近的通讯中继站黑入了余晖中枢"
FireBest PKRelayCheckTTCommission
text:
余晖中枢和星系内的通讯中继站进行信号交互并不罕见。毕竟无论这些 速子科技 麾下的 AI 舰队在哪儿徘徊，都会留下如云雾般密布的间谍卫星和中继转发系统，不停地来回吞吐数据流。虽然这些都安静到几乎能被背景噪音所掩盖，但也不是完全悄然无息。

接入这样一个自我进化出来的网络里获取某个特定的信息绝非易事。你将你的高级军官召集到了一起，考虑能采取什么行动来黑入中枢。
options:
pk_hack:使用 速子科技 的安全编码让这项工作可行
pk_hackStory:向网络开放通讯链接接入
pk_commGoBack:返回

script:
SetEnabled pk_hack false
SetTooltip pk_hack "需要与 速子科技 签订有雇佣协议。"

text:
身为一名 速子科技 公司麾下的签约私掠者，你被给予了一套标准访问编码。这些协议很老旧，而且和公司标准规范渐行渐远 (也许是那些到处闲逛的 AI 们搞的鬼)，不过你的技术官们终归会有技术去适应这些不常见的变动。

由于必须附上准确转换后的访问编码，并使用非常精确地用方式正确地进行询问，检索请求在煞费苦心地认真编写了几个小时之后才发出去，之后却几乎立即就收到了回答，让人不禁有些胆怯。但无论如何，你现在拿到了应该都能通往行星杀手所在位置的导航坐标了。
你的通讯官看起来大吃了一惊，"但是，$playerSirOrMadam，这 ——"
options: pk_hackStory2:"就这么办。我有一个主意。"

text:
你的通讯官输入了指令，一脸的困惑依然没有散去。

"它们的系统构造没考虑过接受通讯，额，完全没有。但，理论上自适应协议应该...也许能进行交互，如果有合适的链接的话..." 

通讯官又在控制台上按了一下，"链接应该开启了，如果有人，有什么东西...在听着的话。"

你的显示台上除了全息雪花噪之外什么都没显示。你的军官都安静了下来，这时信号处理器自顾自地把宇宙背景辐射的嗡响放大到了几乎能听见的音量水平。在这无有之处中，仿佛有片虚空正打着哈欠等着你发话。
options:
pk_hackStoryStartA:"有人吗？"
pk_hackStoryStartB:"我是 $playerName。你是谁？"
pk_hackStoryStartC:"我是 Artemisia Sun，速子科技公司的首席执行官。"
pk_hackStoryStartD:"这是欧米伽在呼叫。我有指令要传达给你。"

text:
有的

你好，$playerName
你好，$playerName

非也，妄语者

你是 $playerName

你没法描述自己到底是怎么听见这些话的。它们仿佛并非由声音传递。你的高级军官们都不由得从空空如也的全息显示台后退了一步，瞪大了双眼，震惊得说不出话来。

你的通讯官和你交换了一个眼色，对，也听到了；不，也不知道那是什么。通讯官将视线从空白的全息显示屏上移开并开始用数据平板遥测缓冲区数据。

options: pk_hackStoryHowName:"你怎么知道我的名字的？"
pk_hackStorySorryLied:"我为向你撒谎一事表示抱歉。从此以后，让我们坦诚相待吧。"
pk_hackStorySorryLied:"我希望我们彼此完全坦诚。"
pk_hackStoryDidYouHack:"你入侵了我的电脑系统吗？"
pk_hackStoryAreYouNexus:"你是余晖的 AI 中枢吗？"
pk_hackStoryYouAreAlpha:"你是个正在拿我寻开心的 Alpha 核心吧。"

text:
吾能感受到斥责，刺探你的隐秘之事
   但其实无需此举
      （它们都径直地写在你身上）

   你可试问：
   你曾
   仰望群星？

   吾便可回
然也

Although nothing appears to change in the holodisplay, you hear nothing more from the voice.

It feels, somehow, as if an animating presence has departed.

Your comms officer looks wide-eyed at you in amazement. The others' expressions range from world-weary incomprehension to barely-suppressed terror.
options: pk_hackStoryEnd:"Reports by end of shift! Dismissed."

text:
Their reports don't tell you anything you couldn't already guess.

The techs who were ordered to run a more paranoid than usual sweep found nothing in your $shipOrFleet's computer systems that wasn't supposed to be there - any more than usual, at least. Nothing of the telemetry recorded during your 'chat' provides anything of use.

The navigational coordinates which appeared in the comms buffer appear valid, however.

text:

我承认，舰长，我没想到你会回来，" $heOrShe说。

script:
AdjustRep luddic_path 10
AdjustRepActivePerson 25
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller -1
$player.turnedInPlanetkiller = true
$player.patherAgreement = true
$player.patherAgreementPermanent = true
AddPotentialContact
HA_CMD gavePKToPather
$receivedAPlanetkillerFromPlayer
text:
你与左径分子协调配合，把行星杀手移交给他们保管。

"这是个值得赞扬的行为， $playerSirOrMadam，为卢德的愿景服务 —— 尽管我们将携手走过的路是如此的黑暗和偏执。"

"你的... 合作行为将由那些真正忠诚的人口口相传。" $HeOrShe再次将双手合十。"愿神圣的和平降临于你，$playerName，直到末日，一切都将受到审判。"
"并不像你想的那样无用，" $heOrShe说。"这是一个被造物主诅咒的图腾，是异教徒害怕和崇拜的恶魔。它拥有力量 —— " $heOrShe克制住了$himOrHerself。你意识到了尽管$heOrShe很兴奋，但还是不要太过公开地谈论左径徒的计划。

$HeOrShe凝视了你好一会儿才开口。"你和我都很清楚，我对你撒谎简直易如反掌。毕竟借口这么多，而我又非圣贤。所以我们就别浪费时间演戏了。"

"武器可以成为一种威慑，也能成为一件凶器。你对这方面的了解应该不比我差。假如我发自内心地宣称它永远不会被使用，而且大家都相信我，那么它就不再是一种威慑。" $HeOrShe顿了顿，继续说道，"——那它就只能成为一件凶器了。这种情况显然对我们大家来说都更加危险，你不觉得吗?"

options: pk_turnInHegemony:"我想谈谈行星杀手武器。"

text: $PersonRank $personLastName 的脸绷紧了。"我没有时间也没有兴趣重新争论 AI 战争的历史，舰长。如果您没有其他紧急事务，那就让我们到此为止吧。"
options:
pk_turnInHegemony2:"你误会了，我找到了一台行星杀手。"
pk_turnInHegemonyAbortEarly:"哦，那就算了。"

text: 海军上将 Rao 的脸绷紧了。"我不想争论 AI 战争的历史，舰长，也不讨论某些叛变的前霸主军官及其罪行。"
options:
pk_turnInHegemony2:"你误会了，我找到了一台行星杀手。"
pk_turnInHegemonyAbortEarly:"哦，那就算了。"

text:
霸主 $post 瞪大了眼睛，$heOrShe说 "我... 我明白了。我们需要派一个技术小组来确认你的说法，并将那台武器送到安全的地方保管。"

$hisOrHer的语气里充满了了怀疑，但那更像是希望你在撒谎而不是真的怀疑。
options:
pk_hegFree:"当然。向有关当局提交违禁武器是每个公民的责任。"
pk_hegPay:"你不认为这样的诚实值得奖励吗？500,000 星币就可以了。"
cutCommLink:切断通讯连接

text:
海军上将 Rao 惊讶地扬起眉毛；但不知为何，他看上去也没有那么惊奇。"我明白了。做得好。我们需要派一个技术小组来确认你的说法，当然也要将那台武器送到安全的地方保管。" 

他的语气中仍然带有怀疑的意味，但可以肯定的是，你已经引起了他的注意。
options:
pk_hegFree:"当然。向有关当局提交违禁武器是每个公民的责任。"
pk_hegPay:"你不认为这样的诚实值得奖励吗？500,000 星币就可以了。"
cutCommLink:切断通讯连接

text:
"你的奉献精神和服务值得赞扬！我以个人的名义向你致敬，因你献身于霸主保护人类及其宜居环境的使命，正如那个许多年前在 Eventide 赋予霸主权力的人 —— 第一任至高霸主 Kali Molina 的愿景一样。"

你肯定 $personName 正在调整姿势记录下这段通讯。
无论如何，霸主的官僚机构运作得很顺利，也许是因为不想再出现一次像摧毁 Opis 那样的 "意外" 。一个技术团队鉴定了这台行星杀手，然后迅速将其移交给了霸主的监管机构，并为你回收大规模杀伤性武器的行为提供了报酬。

"为了霸主的复兴！" $heOrShe狂喜地说。"祝你航行无阻，舰长。"

尽管$PersonRank $personName 个人似乎对你在有一份佣金的情况下还提出这样的要求感到不满，但$hisOrHer上级似乎没有反对意见。

script:
AddCommodity credits 500000
AdjustRep hegemony 5
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller -1
$player.turnedInPlanetkiller = true
$player.ethosMercenary++
$receivedAPlanetkillerFromPlayer
$receivedAPlanetkillerFromPlayerMercenary
text:
霸主的技术团队证实了你持有行星杀手的说法，在星币到账时，他们就把这件武器运出了你的$shipOrFleet。

"如果所有公民都像你一样 '尽职尽责' ，$playerSirOrMadam，我很快就会花光我的部队预算。" $personName 冷淡地说。"祝好。"

options: pk_turnInArroyo1:"嘘，你想要一台行星杀手吗？"

text:
"又是这样。"他冷冷地看了你一眼，"我希望你在爬回来找我之前，没有向任何人兜售过这种曾在人之领时代造成数十亿人死亡的大规模杀伤性武器。"

他的态度直降冰点。

"对吧？"
"不，" 他说。"并且我们从来没谈过关于你卖给我大规模杀伤性武器的事。"
"你已经开过了那个玩笑。" 他说。"那一次并不好笑。"
options:
pk_turnInArroyo2:"我这次是认真的，行星杀手可是个稀罕货。我想到了你，你相当有钱。"
pk_turnInArroyo1joke:"只是想让你度过愉快的一天。"

text:
不出所料，Arroyo 对你的话感到吃惊。

"你认真的？" 他仔细打量着你。
options:
pk_turnInArroyo2:"非常认真。行星杀手非常罕见。我想到了你，因为你很有钱。"
pk_turnInArroyo1joke:"不，仅仅是一个小玩笑。"

text:
"真搞笑。"

他没笑。

"谢谢。"

他听起来并没有多么感谢你。

"好主意，$playerName。"

他抬起眼睛，什么也没有看，考虑着他的选择。如果有什么不同的话，他似乎对你的提议感到压力山大。

"我可以支付 300,000 星币，" 他最终说道。"尽管无需多言，但我需要你对此保密。你先来找我是件好事。"

他眨了眨眼。

"你是首先来找的我，对吧？"

"很好。"

他叹了口气。"300,000 星币。成交？"
options:
pk_turnInArroyo3deal:"成交。"
pk_turnInArroyoMore:"我想要更多星币。"
pk_turnInArroyoNoDeal:"不，我改变主意了。"

text:
他把脸埋在手掌里，深深地吸了一口气。

"你这个白痴，" 他叹了口气说。

"我可以再加 150,000 星币。这是我能对一件热门商品开出的最高价。"
options:
pk_turnInArroyo3dealLow:"成交。"
pk_turnInArroyoNoDeal:"不，我改主意了。

text: "太糟糕了，" 他说。"你只能找其他人来购买你那台，害死过数十亿人的 人之领 时代大规模杀伤性武器了。"
options:
pk_turnInArroyo3deal:"我改主意了。300,000 星币是个好价钱。"
pk_turnInArroyoNoDeal2:"这正是我接下来要做的事。"

text: "祝你好运，希望你能卖掉你的，害死过数十亿人的 人之领 时代大规模杀伤性武器。" 他说道。不知怎的，他的语气让你觉得不真诚。

$isPerson

text:
"啊，" $heOrShe摆出一副高贵的微笑。"我很遗憾我们并现在没有任何可供出售的物品，但如果您想提交您的联系方式来浏览其他商品... "

"我们还有一系列令人眼花缭乱的低当量武器，包括 AM 催化聚变装置，在民用和私人军事承包商方面都有着良好的记录。我非常乐意为您提供一个目录，包括我们的 速子科技 全息体验，其中包括我们亲自挑选的一些最受欢迎的物品。"
options:
pk_turnInTT2:"我不是来买的，我是来卖东西的。"
pk_turnInTTCatalog:"我这就带着目录离开。"

text:
"哦！" $heOrShe惊叫道，"请接受我的道歉，$playerSirOrMadam。我们并不经常遇到，呃，这种东西的供应商。"

$HeOrShe快速地在 TriPad 上点击着什么东西，同时欢快的贸易人格瞬间降低了几个档次。

"如果你说的是真的 —— 在付款之前，我们必须让一名技术人员，嗯，检查一下那个东西。请放心，我们会尽最大努力保密。这只不过是 速子科技 尊重我们宝贵合作伙伴的隐私的保障。"
options:
pk_ttFree:"我把行星杀手免费送你怎么样，这样速子科技就会欠我一个人情，一个大大的人情。"
pk_ttPay:协商要求 500,000 星币的报酬
cutCommLink:切断通讯连接

text:
那副高贵的笑容再一次像面具一样凝固在了$heOrShe的脸上。

"我很遗憾地说，这样的安排是不可能的，$playerSirOrMadam。当然了，你必须明白，我们 —— 指我和我的合作伙伴，都欠股东一份投资和利润的量化报告。"

"一个如此重大的开放式承诺是，嗯... "$heOrShe斟词酌句，露出了恶心的表情，最终找到了他$heOrShe想要的形容词。"非商业行为的。"
